so beck sent me a link to urlLink this article which talks about a travel company that has chartered a nude flight from florida to cancun. "Once the plane reaches its cruising altitude, passengers will be invited to disrobe." souh... why do they have to wait until cruising altitude, really? and does the flightstaff disrobe as well? and what will the inflight movie be? there will be no hot drinks served on the flight, and nude passengers will have to keep a towel between them and the seat... that's icky... could you imagine how cold the seat belt buckle would feel on your lap? The article states that they feel that it's a stress relieving environment because when everyone's nude, they're all the same. i beg to differ. i think looking around a plane and seeing a whole bunch of ugly naked people (because come on now, nudists are always the ugly ones) would be pretty stressful... can you imagine if you didn't realize it was a nude flight you were getting on? when the captain says, "we've now reached our cruising altitude of blahdeeblah thousand feet, i'm going to turn off the seatbelt sign and the flight attendants will be around with the beverage cart. and uh, it's getting hot in here, so take off all your clothes." and when they're landing, will they say, "we are now beginning our descent. please make sure your traytables and seats are in an upright and locked position and put your damn clothes on you ugly bunch of freaks!" if i was a flight attendant, they'd have to pay me like, triple time to work that flight. ew.

so after posting the last post i realized that i was still bored and curious. i needed to see where else urlLink william bader has gone and made uninteresting. he's got dozens of "trip reports" in which he details everything about his trips. i'm hooked. i find his webpage ("the official william bader website") oddly amusing. urlLink the blondie trip makes me giggle. it's like he's some snl character, the guy's so uninteresting... i feel horrible for laughing at him... please, does anyone else out there find his page even half as amusing as i do?

i stumbled across urlLink this page while surfing out of complete boredom tonight. it's all about some guy's business trip to albany. it is incredibly detailed and boring. he has a picture for every comment. or a comment for every picture. whatever. but he's got a lot of really boring pictures. and really boring comments. something about it just struck me as hilarious only i don't think i was laughing with him but rather laughing at him. which kinda makes me feel bad. ah well, i'm sure a lot of people have laughed at me/this site so whatever. anyway, the weirdest thing about urlLink this page is the ending. he all of a sudden talks about a spontaneous chanukah store and he has a picture of himself saying that it's what he'd look like without glasses. very odd. who does he show this site to? can you imagine family gatherings when he's got some relative cornered telling them about his trip and showing the accompanying pictures of nothing?

weekend recap continued sunday so sunday i woke up after i'd gotten exactly 8 hours of sleep: at 935am. this is what my body does. it says, hey now, you've had 8 hours and that's quite enough, thank you, so get your lazy ass out of bed and don't waste the day! so i was freezing because eric and sarah's apartment (like mine) is not heated in the morning. and it was damn cold. so i got in the shower (which thank the lord was warm) and got ready for the day. at 10am when i was all ready to do something everyone else was still asleep. and i was freezing and my hair was wet. so i sat in the spare bedroom that i slept in and looked around for something to do. i couldn't find much. actually, i couldn't find anything to do. eric's computer is broken, so i couldn't play with it, and the tv was in the living room where ryan and his girlfriend were sleeping on the pullout couch and the only book in the room just didn't look interesting to me. so i sat in the bed covered up trying not to freeze to death or die of boredom. at 1030 i remembered that my phone was charging in the kitchen so i grabbed it and downloaded ms. pacman and pong and played those for a while. then i text messaged beck. at 11 i couldn't take the cold anymore so i ran out to the kitchen and started boiling water in the teapot and hunted out the tea in the cabinet. couldn't find it for a while and contemplated just pouring the boiling water over me to combat the cold. finally found the tea... drank warm tea for an hour until people finally started to wake up. (to be fair, when eric woke up and i told him i'd been up since 930 he said that i should've waken him... but i wouldn't have done that...) so about 1 when everyone was up and moving we walked to a diner that was nearby. it was so cold, i thought i'd die. we passed this one street where there were all these little yellow outlines of people painted on the sidewalk. i'm not sure what they were for. perhaps they have something to do with kids or school or something. but they looked like this: . So Ryan says, "this must be where all the midgets died." so the diner was your typical downstate diner, with people of all ethnic origins waiting tables, bussing tables and seating tables wearing various forms of tuxedo type uniforms. and of course there was a manager guy pacing around, a youngish guy wearing a dark suit. we ordered breakfast items even though it was 1pm and sarah ordered a small orange juice. it was priced at $1.20 in the menu. and when they brought it out it was the size of a shot glass. unbelievable. (but cute, at the same time) soyeah. so we had a decent brunch and then headed back for the apartment. on the way back Jenny stepped in some poop on the sidewalk. and it was funny because just before she did it eric said "you better watch out for that poop jenny... poop jenny... poop poop poop !" and then when she debated whether she hit it or not he said, "yeah, you grazed it with the left side of your shoe" to which ryan added "it was at a 45 degree angle..." it was just too funny. i parted from the group at the apartment and headed for the subway. it was a little after 2, and i wanted to make the 353 train to poughkeepsie out of grand central, so i pretty much had to leave then to be sure that i'd make it. also, i was planning on taking the local R all the way up to 42nd street and then taking the shuttle over to grand central, and that would've taken forever, but i didn't feel like transferring. but when i got on the subway there was a delay at one of the stops still in brooklyn where the 4 train also ran so i switched over and caught the 4 express and made it to grand central just after the 253 train left. so i bummed around the train station for a while. i was going to walk around outside, but it was just too damn cold. i bought a cosmo to read on the way home. so on the train to poughkeepsie i wipped out my cosmo and began reading the slightly racy articles with the even racier pictures. so of course while i have the magazine open to one of the racier pages a nun sits down next to me. she was this really cute older woman with an italian accent. and i said, "good afternoon" which is weird because i never say that. but apparently when i talk to nuns/priests/bishops i blurt out expressions that i never say in real life (Bishop asks me if i have any irish in me and i say "a wee bit" when I'm being confirmed). soanyway. soyeah. i don't know what to do. i feel like some awful sinner sitting there with this magazine and she's so sweet and i don't want her to see it so i don't know if it's worse if i just close it fast and put it away or just sit there with it on my lap and try not to draw any attention to it. so i kinda sat there with the magazine as closed as i could get it to sheild it from her view. the conductor came around and i handed him my ticket and the nun indicated that she needed to buy a ticket to tarrytown and he told her that she was all set, she didn't need to pay, and she was so cute, she giggled and winked at me. but i was just sitting there thinking, oh thank god she's getting off at tarrytown, that's really close, i don't have to worry about the magazine too much longer. so the rest of the day was uneventful. i was lost for a minute in poughkeepsie trying to get to the bridge before i realized that i was right where i wanted to be... i didn't speed on the way home. i had to set my cruise control at 74 so that i wouldn't (ok, i know that 74 is speeding, but it's been my experience - and it was my experience last night - that you can fly by troopers at 74 and they won't pull you over). when i got home i lost my pictures from my camera in the computer crash (dammit!), and watched tv: i was flipping from there's something about mary on fox, the playoffs on cbs and the golden globes on nbc. soyeah... so that was my weekend. wee!

weekend recap Friday saw urlLink just married at crossgates. the movie was ok... most of the funny parts were in the previews. i enjoyed it. i was also drunk... i had 2 bermuda triangles beforehand at houlihan's. a bermuda triangle is a drink with like three or four different kinds of rum in it (including urlLink bacardi 151 ) and it's very strong and they limit you to 2 per guest. but it's tasty... soyeah. so i enjoyed the movie but i'm not sure if that was a function of the rum consumption (love that rhyme) or not. yeah. so there was this awesome dog in the very beginning of the movie. it was adorable... a little urlLink french bull dog . i need one. that is my perfect dog. they're mini and tough looking and they have attitude. definitely need one. Saturday didn't get out of bed till 10... showered and headed to clifton park to borrow money from my wam so that i could go to the city. (yeah... didn't get to post about that, but it turns out that my bank just really sucks altogether and my payroll check isn't coming off float until tuesday at the earliest so i had to borrow money from my parents for this weekend... annoying) was on the road to poughkeepsie by noon. drove extremely fast and got there in about 45 minutes. very scary. i halved the time the trip should take. was early for the train (for a change) and had to wait in the cold for a few minutes. thus beginning my weekend of extreme coldness. train ride into the city was uneventful... cold... got to grand central and found my friends: eric, sarah, sarah's sister jenny, ryan, and ryan's girlfriend corey. we did the hello/introduction thing and headed for the subway to go to urlLink the american museam of natural history . we accidently got on an express and ended up having to double back, and we only got to the museam at 425 (and it closed at 545). we paid the "suggested admission price" of $12... why do they call it that, really? who's going to pay less than that? who's going to stand there and say, "i really don't want to pay $12. here's $11" or "here's $1, that's all this museam is worth to me." i mean, if they were going to do it that way, they should make you pay at the end. then you should pay what you feel the museam was worth... whatever. anyway... we came in on the lowest level (LL) and we decided that we were going to take the elevator up to floor 4 to see the dinosaurs. well, the dinosaur bones. anyways... so we waited for the elevator, but every time the door opened, we weren't paying attention or weren't quick enough and tons of people with kids and strollers would pile in and we'd be left standing there. so finally we made a concerted effort and got aboard. and the elevator filled to capacity (or, really, what i would consider capacity) right there on the LL. but we had to go through floors 1, 2, and 3 before we got to our final destination. and on each floor, people would get on. now, i'm slightly claustrophobic. not really so bad, but i tend to get a little... crazy/panicky... when i'm in a super crowded space. and an elevator is the worst, because it could get stuck and you could be stuck in this small supercrowded space for god knows how long running out of air breathing everybody else's exhaust smelling everybody around you stuck there listening to stupid people and who knows the elevator could plummet to the bottom and that could be how you die. soyeah. so this elevator was crowded and there was some odd woman standing across from me by the buttons staring at me with her wierd bugeyes and there was a baby on her dad's shoulders right at head level with me and her diaper was full. and so i started to get hysterical. laughing at first silently to myself but by the time we got off it was kind of a crazy giggle. it wasn't helped by the fact that jenny mentioned that the capacity for the elevator was 6000lbs and eric replied that that was a lot of people and in my head i thought or just a few really fat people and that got me laughing even more. i was so happy when we reached floor 4 and i could get out into the hall and breathe air that wasn't directly expelled from someone pressed against me. so we saw the dino bones. there would be pictures here but when i transferred and deleted the pics from this weekend off of my camera my computer crashed and i lost all of the pics and that sucks. there were only 12 pictures, but it's still annoying. anyway. so there was this one dino that was called an aliramadon or something like that and i thought that was cool :) so yeah. so we wandered around the museam for a while and then it was closing time so we left. so we went to dinner at urlLink chevy's in time square. they told us that the wait for a table for 6 would be about 20 minutes. so we waited and waited and waited and waited. and in the meantime some group of 12 came in with this really annoying girl who we dubbed the captain. we called her that because she kept calling the group her "party" and she kept speaking with the hostest trying to get them seated quicker. and she was really ass annoying. she kept pacing back and forth and calling places looking for other members of her party. and she had a tail. well, she had some sort of ribbon sticking out of the back of her sweater and i thought that was odd. i wanted to pull on it and see what would happen. anyway. we were all starving and really thirsty and getting very impatient. everytime they got on the loudspeaker and said "chevy's would like to welcome..." we'd get all excited but it just wasn't to be. sothen we were getting all irritated and this captain girl because they got there after us and it looked like her annoyance was going to get them seated before us. and that's just not right. so when we saw a big table clear up, eric (our captain) went up and told the hostess that that table was ours and that if they sat the "party" there, there'd be issue. but they told him that the party would be sat there, and that they were clearing off a booth for us right then. but the big party got sat before us. and that captain was very irritating. she made a big show of standing on one side of us and motioning hugely with her arms and yelling to her party, "come on guys!" we tried to trip them and we gave them dirty looks as they walked by because dammit we were starving and parched and we were there first and it wasn't fair that captain annoying's party got sat before us. so shortly afterwards we were seated and when i went to the bathroom the captain was there and i discovered that her tail was part of a horrible sheer shirt that she had on under the sweater and i just wanted to tell captain annoying that she should have left the sweater on. butyeah. soanyways. the food was great. sothen after dinner we walked over to the big urlLink toys r us in times square . it was a fun store... i quite enjoyed the huge so the other night i had a dream that i was murdering two people. that sounds very scary, i know. but it wasn't anyone i know (that somehow makes it better). i mean, i guess i knew them in the dream, i think i had a good reason for killing them. anyway, so i decided that i'd look up "murder" at urlLink dreammoods.com . "To dream that you have committed a murder, indicates that you are putting an end to an old habit and your former ways of thinking. This could also mean an end to an addiction. Alternatively, you may have some repressed aggression or rage at yourself or at others. Note also that dreams of murder occur frequently during periods of depression." okso, i hope i don't have any repressed aggression or rage. and i hope i'm not depressed. and i know i haven't been addicted to anything. so i guess my dream of murder means that i've put an end to an old habit and former ways of thinking. huh. i wonder what that was... anyway. so it also said to look up "killing". "To dream that you killed someone, forewarns that heavy stress may cause you to lose your temper and self-control. Identity the characteristics of the person that you have killed and ask yourself if you feel any rage towards this person in your waking life. You may be expressing some rage or hatred toward this person... This dream may also represent a part of you or your life that you wish would leave you alone and stop creating a nuisance. Killing may represent the killing off of old parts of yourself and old habits." ok. well, i'm hoping that i'm not heading for some sort of heavy stress. and i don't know who these people i've killed were, so the characteristic thing doesn't really apply. hmm.. then we're back to the habits/old parts/ways thing. i must've recently changed my ways of thinking about something. cause i'm not sure what habit i might have broken... anyway. disturbing to dream that you're murdering people...

so afraid to answer my phone... so afraid. i have a claim where my insured (veh 1) was driving straight down the street and the claiment (veh 2) pulled out from a parking lot to make a left and my insured ran into the side of her. the claiment claims that my insured ran a red light and she's provided me with a witness saying that he did. but the problem with that is there's no mention on the police report that he did. and there's no mention of a witness. normally in a case like this the police report will say something like, "op veh 1 states he was driving straight down ___ ave when veh 2 pulled out in front of him causing him to hit her. op veh 2 states that she was pulling out to make a left onto ___ ave when veh 1 ran red light and struck her. witness 1 states that veh 1 ran red light and struck veh 2." but the police report didn't say anything like that. all it said was "veh 1 was westbound on ___ave when it struck veh 2 which was turning left from ____ parking lot to go eastbound on ____ ave." then police reports always give "apparent contributing factors" to an accident. on this report it said that veh 1 was going at an unsafe speed and that veh 2 failed to yield the right of way. see, when you're deciding who's what percentage at fault for an accident you compare the negligence. so my guy was speeding, which was wrong, and which contributed to him hitting the claiment. but the claiment pulled out into the street from a parking lot to make a left in front of my insured. because she's pulling out into a street making a left, she bears the greater responsibility to make sure that it's safe to make her turn. and according to the police report, the parking lot is 55 feet west of the intersection. so the traffic light does not control the parking lot. so it doesn't matter if he ran the light. i tried to explain that to her, but she wasn't havin it. i told her we'd accept 40% of the responsibility, which is really a gift because according to the police report she failed to yield that right of way and that's worse than speeding. ugh. anyway. so i left her a message telling her we were standing by our offer and that btw her car was a total loss so we'll pay her 40% of the actual cash value of it and she's so not going to be happy. ugh. please phone, don't ring. better yet, i'm putting it on do not disturb...

so yesterday i got a claim where one of our insureds, a 17 y/o kid, plowed down an old lady in a parking lot. so i called up gramma and she said that the kid wipped around a corner and hit her cart which pushed into her, knocking her on the ground. i told her my spiel about no-fault coverage blah blah blah. then after i hung up the phone with her i told my supervisor how gramma's cart got hit by the car which pushed gramma down. my supervisor then proceeded to speculate how we may not have to cover the claim because the car didn't actually hit gramma. she called some friends at other companies and finally concluded that we should, indeed, cover the claim because the car was the proximate cause of gramma's injuries. i was pretty skeeved out by the whole thing though. i mean, it's not like gramma's cart rammed into her of it's own volition. we were obviously at fault for gramma's injuries, and i just thought it was awful that we were trying to get out of covering them. ick.

wearing of apparel... likely to provoke disturbances... is prohibited okso, i never really watch urlLink the news anymore because i enjoy urlLink repeats of old tv shows too much. soyeah. so i was surprised when i followed urlLink this link off of urlLink msn.com that read "man arrested over t-shirt" because it happened right in albany. at crossgates. weird. apparently this guy and his son had anti-war t-shirts made and they wore them while they were shopping at the mall. some store owner or worker or something thought they were creating a disturbance and called security who asked them to leave. so i guess they refused to leave or whatever (hey, i would too.) and guilderland police were called and they arrested the guy. they said they arrested him for refusing to leave the mall which is private property so that's trespassing. ok, i can't believe they were asked to leave to begin with! they were wearing tshirts that expressed their point of view. whatever. so they've posted signs now that say "wearing of apparel... likely to provoke disturbances... is prohibtited". so what is the determination for disturbance? because those little chicas who strut around in next to nothing and they're 14 years old are disturbing to me. as are the older women who wear frumpy dresses, black nylons, and white running shoes. can i have them kicked out?

so saturday i took a defensive driving course that a woman that i work with was offering. i figured, hey, i wasn't doing anything else that day and i could use a 10% discount on my insurance so even though it was probably going to be boring i'd do it. soyeah. so saturday morning i really wanted a mcdonald's bacon egg and cheese bagel. like, i felt that i needed one. but unfortunately i didn't leave the apt early enough so that i could stop before class and get one. so i just went straight to class (and ended up having to hang out for a bit while they set up) and was baconeggandcheesebageless. so class started and there were only 5 of us there and the woman teaching it (cindy) was really funny and it was very relaxed and it wasn't too bad. at 1030 cindy asked us if we wanted a break. so i said, well is mcdonald's still serving breakfast? and she said, yeah, it's a weekend, they serve until 11. and i was like, you sure? and she said, yeah. so i said i'd be right back and i ran out to my car. on the way out my coworker meredith who was taking the class with me said, "take your license in case you get pulled over for speeding" and i said, "oh, that's not gonna happen" but i grabbed it anyway. so i sped out of the parking lot and out of the complex and turned onto albany shaker road to go the less than a mile to the mcdonald's. and i flew by a sherrif and totally got pulled over. yeah. so i sat there trying not to get hysterical with laughter because i thought it was just too funny that i was coming from a defensive driving course and i was getting pulled over. i dug out my license and then rememebered that i never try and look too prepared ('cause it's easier to look innocent and get out of a ticket if it looks like you don't get pulled over that often) so i put my license away again and tried to work up the tears (which was difficult this time because it was too humorous that i was getting pulled over then). the sheriff walked up to the car (and damn he was cute) and i rolled down the window and gave him the big innocent eyes. i tried to make myself shake too. (god, i'm awful). he asked me for my license, registration and proof of insurance. i handed him my license and told him that it was the only thing i had with me. he asked me if i knew what the speed limit on albany shaker road is. i kinda bit my lip and opened my eyes wider (gee, sir, i have no idea) and he told me to turn around because it was right behind me. i couldn't see because of his car and i told him that, then he said it's 40 mph. he asked me if i knew how fast i was going. i put on the look again. he told me i was going 60 mph. (damn). then he asked me where i was coming from. i looked down at my steering wheel and said, "you're going to laugh at me" then i looked up and said "i'm coming from a defensive driving class" and i looked down again. the sheriff looked away for a second and said, "where's that" and i pointed towards the industrial park and said "over in the mercury insurance building" and he said, "where are you going?" and i said "well, i was starving and i really wanted a bacon egg and cheese bagel so i was going to mcdonald's" and he looked away again and then said, "is there more class today?" and i said "yes, it goes until 3" and he handed me back my license and said "here, go learn more" and walked back to his car. rock! i rule! i am the luckiest person ever! i love being a girl! i just thought it was too funny that i got pulled over during a defensive driving class. but my trip was in vain because i got to mcdonald's and they were already serving lunch (damn!). so when i got back to class and had no mcdonald's they asked me what took so long and i had to explain that i'd gotten pulled over for speeding (but didn't get a ticket). everybody cracked up at me... then some of the other women in the class asked me how i managed to do that and i explained my technique. so if they didn't learn how to be better drivers at least they got some tips on how to avoid tickets...

here is the accident description off of a police report for a claim that i'm handling: "op v1 lost control on snow covered road striking v2. v2 pushed into v3. v1 then continued e/b about 100 ft striking v4 & v5. v5 pushed into v6 & v6 pushed into v7." wow. i'm so glad that my insd is not v1. what a moron! talk about having a bad day... yeah. i got into an accident. i hit 6 parked cars. dumbass.

so last night i was watching urlLink cartoon network really late at night when they have their urlLink adult swim on. there was this weird show on which apparently was called urlLink lupin the 3rd . i think lupin is a thief and he's got two friend thieves and there's some inspector guy that's always following them around trying to catch them and there's this chick who lupin wants but she's like a rival thief or something and she keeps betraying him and his friends are like, "tool, that girl sucks, don't trust her" and lupin's like "uh, come on guys, she's hot" and the girl's hair color keeps changing but i guess that doesn't matter because she's got big tatas (that is my least favorite euphamism for breasts. people just sound like morons when they say it. they use it down south. 'nuff said.). anyway, so the show was odd and stupid in that typical urlLink anime way, but also completely enjoyable (perhaps it was the late hour that made it so...). so check out the urlLink lupin website ... if you go to the multimedia section you can download sideburns that you can apply to your face (they caution that you should not use superglue) and have that 1337 lupin style.

so wednesday night i met beck in new paltz and we had dinner at a thai restaurant called Lemongrass (or something like that). so the food was good. the shrimp spring rolls were excellent. but they should warn you when they're going to serve something cold. i ordered this dish called yum duck (ok, beck and i are so immature, because we kept giggling at the names of the dishes). it was duck with cucumbers and tomatoes and cashew nuts and "brown sauce". it was a salad. well this girl didn't realize that it was a salad until she dug in and popped the first bite in her mouth. and then i wanted to die. it was so cold... and i expected hot... the salad was ok. but there was something in it that tasted like licorice and it totally grossed me out and brought me back to last saturday night with those nasty shots... ugh... never again... soyeah. if you're ever in new paltz and you like thai food, go to lemongrass (also, you have to like to spend money because damn, it was expensive).

my job just keeps getting weirder. today i got a claim for an inmate at lawrence county jail who was injured in a car accident. i'm assuming this happened before he was in jail. maybe it happened during an escape attempt... i wonder if we'd have to cover that... i mean, i bet there's nothing in the policy explicitly stating that we wouldn't cover that...

so i got a claim yesterday where this guy's car caught fire. so i had to call him today and get a recorded interview about what happened. it was a long interview which consisted of around 100 questions, so i wasn't really looking forward to doing it. so i get on the phone with the guy and he's a talker. a real talker. the freaking converstion lasted for 50 minutes (i know because i was watching the minutes tick away on the timer on my phone). i just cannot wait to transcribe that recorded statement word for word (not). so the guy's an idiot though. his freaking car caught fire and he can't tell me which fire deparmtment responded to the call. dumbass. of course it didn't happen within the nearby city where the paid department would've answered the call. it happened outside of the city where one of the local volunteer departments responded. but he couldn't tell me which one. dumbass. i'm like, dude, did you look at the truck? or the back of their jackets? dammit. now i have to do extra work... what's really irritating is he had all these details about what he did that day ("well we left the house at 11am... or no, i gueess it was earlier than that because it was too early for lunch, so it was probably 1030, no 10am..."), the fire and what happened ("I can tell you for a fact that the fire happened at about 5:46 pm..."), and where they took the car afterwards ("now the road that it's on is either rte 311 or plank road. i know this because we had a discussion on it. but i think it was plank road because i have the business card right here and i picked it up on the counter there on the way out...") and everything... but he couldn't tell me who put out the fire for him. (ingrate) so he's telling me about the car fire and he's like, "well, i was walking around to the side of the car to open the door for my mom (hey, i'm italian, we're dogs but we're gentleman)..." (and at this point i was laughing at him) "...and i noticed smoke coming from the back tire so i looked down and got my head down there right next to the tire and i saw flames inside of it and they were going back under the car towards the gas tank. so i walked to my mom's window and knocked on it and told her to get out of the car. she, being a woman, decided to argue with me. so i knocked on the window again and told her to get out of the car. so she got out and i walked her away from the car and then i walked back and unlocked the trunk and got her suitcases out and then i ran inside the diner and asked to use their phone because my car was on fire." so i'm like, damn dude. your car's on fire so you just knock on the window and tell your mom to get out of the car and then you take the time to get your bags out of the trunk but you never try and put the fire out? damn, dude. when the fire department came they put it out with a fire extinguisher. (course then they hosed down the car afterwards). but damn. i mean, i get the impression from what he said that he coulda put it out with a fire extinguisher which i'm sure they had in the diner. dumbass. i mean, he obviously didn't think that he was in too great danger if he freaking took the time to get bags out of the trunk. dumbass.

well, it happened again. my freaking computer crashed. badly. i set it to work this morning transferring songs to my minidisc player and then got in the shower. when i got out of the shower it had, of course, crashed. frankly, i expected this. unfortunately it crashed much harder than i thought it would. it had tried to reboot but couldn't start windows so i had a black screen in front of me saying "so, um... i couldn't start windows... yeah. i'm, like, missing this essential file or something. so, like, you should try and repair me by using the original windows disc or something. yeah. good luck with that." (ok, that's not exactly what it said, but that's pretty much the gist of it. so of course i haven't tried to fix it yet because i had to go to work and i won't have time tonight to try and get it up and limping (cause, yeah, that stupid machine doesn't exactly run anymore, it pretty much limps). so i went ahead and bought a dell. it's not as rash a decision as it seems. i've been looking at prices for a while and i figured for a brand new computer it wasn't a bad price. so rock. new computer soon. now i'll be able to sleep at night without having to close my bedroom door because the computer in the next room is too loud.

on why i hate gloversville so i think the stupidest people in the world live in Gloversville, New York. or perhaps it's the whole of urlLink fulton county that's moronic. but seriously, stupid people live there and we insure like the whole town of gloversville apparently. here are just a few examples of the stupidity of people in that town: 1) People out there do stupid things. Like slam their hands in car doors. I've had two claims so far where some dumbass out there has slammed their hand in their car door. 2) People out there apparently just back up without looking. I've had two claims where people have backed out of their driveways into someone parked across the street. Duh. 3) People out there name their children really stupid things. Like Honeybee. And (ohmygod i almost laugh everytime i have to call this woman) Squeeker. (who does that to their kid?!) 4) I just took a claim this morning where some dumbass from Gloversville backed into a parked police car. Dumbass. He was in the parking lot of the Police Department and was leaving and backed into a police car. It was 1am. What was he doing there? What a moron. 5) Girls in Gloversville get married when they are 16 years old. And they marry guys who are 28 years old. And that's disgusting. And I can't even begin to count the number of times I've been talking to a 19 year old girl from Gloversville and I've asked the question: "What do you do for a living?" and they say, "oh, I'm a stay at home mom" and you can hear children screaming in the background. And these "stay-at-home-moms" almost always live with their grandmothers. 6) Kids in Gloversville mow down little old ladies in Price Chopper parking lots and then never bother to tell their insurance companies. i could go on... but i think you get the point. people from gloversville are stupid. never go there.

so... this weekend was supposed to be quiet... friday was pretty quiet. beck came over and we watched urlLink darby o'gill and the little people . it's an old disney movie and sean connery is in it and he sings. it's pretty funny (although i don't think it's supposed to be funny in the way it amused us). the parts with the leprechauns dancing were freaking hilarious. i've seen guys dance like that when they're drunk... :) and there's this one part where the death coach or whatever is coming for darby. it gets there and the door opens and this big, booming, echoey voice says "darby o'gill..." and it pauses for a second then it says, "get in." it's just too funny... :) soyeah. that was friday... saturday i went to my parents house and saw their new dog. her name is lilly. she's a tiny little puppy... she's only 10 weeks old. she's really adorable. i was so excited all morning to go see the puppy and then i got there and i was like, "aww, she's so cute" and then i didn't know what to do with her. i mean, she's just a baby. she doesn't really play yet. so... later i went with beck to walk. we were just supposed to walk around the malls. but then we ended up buying boots (really cheap! $15!) and urlLink hella cute t-shirts at urlLink american eagle . so later we went to urlLink malt river brewing company to see urlLink hair of the dog . so i had a gin and tonic... then i had another one... then i had another one... and then i had a shot... and then i pounded a guinness... so yeah. damn. i was pretty blitzed. in fact i don't remember part of the night. i remember everything up to being in the kitchen at steve's house later on. i did a shot of aftershock with alex and jason. i remember doing the shot and putting the shotglass down somewhere in the kitchen. then the memory stops... i get a few little glimpses of memories... but yeah. wow. sunday was not so good. i was so so so hungover. and so sick for most of the day. i felt like death until around 4 and then i felt like someone had stepped on me... ugh. so i had to take my dad to get his eyes laser corrected that night. it was being done in the parking lot behind a howard johnson's. sounds sketchy, i know. but apparently lasik vision has this traveling truck that goes around to different areas. the doctors etc were all from washington dc. so dad said that the procedure wasn't so bad. not really painful, but you could smell the flesh burning when the laser fired. ew... dad just called me a little while ago. he can see. his vision went from 20/400 to 20/30. that's freaking awesome. i'm so jealous. i'm totally saving up and having that done.

so congrats (i can't spell the whole world) go out to urlLink eric and sarah ! if you read the comments on this site you'll see that eric proposed to sarah in feb. Congrats! :) wow. the first one of my friends (around my age) to get engaged. this must mean we're old.

i'm fighting the russian mob so there's a lot of fraud in insurance. that's a pretty "duh" statement. but it's true. especially in the type of insurance that i handle, which is no-fualt insurance. soyeah. so this one claim that i have is hellafulla fraud. i'm not even positive that the one person exists. and i'm certain that neither of these women are injured to the extent that their "doctors" are saying. i'm sure these doctors don't exist either. they suck. so i was complaining to my supervisor about it and she said that what i have there is a fraud ring run most likely by the russian mob (because apparently they're big in medical fraud). so now i'm fighting the russian mob. scary. it sounds a lot cooler than nofault claims rep though.

so check out the urlLink starbuck's oracle . the little oracle guy is horribly mean looking (and cute!) it tells you what your personality type is according to what type of drink you order. i normally order a tall caramel macchiato.

fireguy, you just blew my mind so i call the dumbasses that i have claims for at work by nicknames. like i have bigfatliarlyn and ewhighmaitenancegirl and dumbasswhoshuthishandincar. and the dumbass whose car was on fire last week is fireguy. so i got the appraisal back on fireguy's car and it wasn't a total loss (which he was absolutely convinced it was going to be). in fact, the car looked in great condition! the only damage was the wheel was off in the back. fireguy told me that the wheel melted off. that was an exaggeration considering the wheel was still usable. soyeah. so when i saw that fireguy's car wasn't a total loss and that in fact the appraiser hadn't even written for a new wheel i called the appraiser and asked him what was up. so bob gets on the phone and is like, "what can i do for you dear?" (because bob is a rougharoundtheedges car appraiser i don't care if he calls me dear) and i start asking him if the wheel is still usable and if there was any apparrent water damage to the car. and bob's like, yes and no. so i'm like, "yeah, the insured was convinced that it was a total loss and when i got your pictures i was like, 'damn, dude, what are ya talking about?'" and then i couldn't believe that i just said "damn, dude" during a business call. bob apparently thought it was funny that i said that (thank God) and he was still laughing at me when we hung up the phone. meanwhile, i get a copy of the title to fireguy's car with a not attached that says, "i sent the signed original to firestone". firestone is the shop that has his car. i'm thinking, "moron. your car is not a total loss. no one ever told you your car is a total loss. in fact, it's only gonna take about $650 to fix the damages to your car. i can't believe you just gave up your car to some random shop." so i decide to play dumb and i call the guy and leave a message on his machine: "hey mr. ___ it's Ali from Mercury. i got the appraisal back on your car and it turns out it's not a total loss! give me a call!" so like minutes later the guy returns my call. and i'm all afraid that he's gonna start yelling at me because his car is way fixable and he just gave up the title to it. so i get on the phone with him all preparing for a horrible conversation and he's like, "gee, you don't think it's totaled? well, it's totaled in my mind. i've already turned in the plates to DMV and sent the title to the shop so they can donate it to the fire department and cancelled my policy." and i explain to him that since it's not a total loss by our standards i can only give him what the cost to fix it would be minus his $200 deductible and he's like, "oh, that's fine. i'll use that towards a down payment on another car." so basically, this guy just pretty much sold his car, which was in great condition, for $400 and he's happy about it. (oh, and he'll get a tax deduction because he donated it). i couldn't believe it, i totally thought he was trying to get us to total it out so he'd get more money towards it 'cause he was looking to get rid of it. so i hung up the phone and said, "fireguy, you just blew my mind." and i was so happy that i controlled myself that time and managed to hang up the phone before i blurted it out.

so i had a pretty excellent weekend. friday we went to see urlLink hotd at mcgeary's. always a good time. it was hella hella crowded in there, and they had the drummer instead of the tall guy. but big guy did a good job at finnagin's wake. afterwards we went to a pizza shop down the street and ate yummy pizza (ok, it was yummy at the time. but i'm sure if we went there in the middle of the day it would not be). one of the guys, murph, that was out with our friends came wondering in the shop. he's a urlLink paid firefighter in albany . so yeah, they left him at the bar. and he just happened to wonder into the pizza shop. so we all sat and talked for a while ( urlLink brazil ) and then we dropped murph off at urlLink his firehouse . saturday morning came bright and early... beck and i got up early enough so that we could stop at urlLink mcdonalds for greasy breakfast before we picked up beck's friend amy at urlLink the train station . we got lost on the way to the train station (damn mappoint and their ambiguous directions!) but we got there before her train did. we went back to my place after a quick stop at urlLink dunkin donuts for some rank coffee and watched tv until we decided to head on over to murph's party at the union hall. we parked (beck drove the wrong way down a one way street. we told her she was fine at the time, we didn't think it was a one way, but later when i went back with alex to pick up her car i realized that it was a one way) and headed inside. and started drinking. it was 11am. the party was packed and they were playing hotd, so i had fun :) later we walked down to watch the parade. alex and i went into urlLink pauly's hotel (a bar) and got 4 urlLink guinnesses . we thought they'd give them to us in plastic cups, but they gave them to us in glasses. so we just walked out anyway. i can't believe they let us walk out. we just walked right past like 3 bouncers at the door. soyeah. so i don't remember watching that much of the parade. then afterwards we went to my apartment so everyone could use the potty. we walked to the urlLink AOH hall but we didn't end up staying long because there were no bands playing and people were getting hungry. after napping and watching urlLink super troopers at my apartment we went to urlLink Garcia's for dinner. alex found a table by the bar that happened to be the "worst table in the place." we got 1/2 off of our bill for eating there. rock! we went to urlLink the parting glass to see urlLink hotd but we didn't end up staying long. after a long day of drinking and then mexican food, no one could really drink that much more, and everyone was pretty tired. so we went back to my place. i saw urlLink willard that night. very odd. really kinda creepy. not scary, but just weird. and gross. i had a horrible dream later that i was puking up dead rats. (oh, that's disgusting) sunday morning we picked up eric and sarah to go to brunch. we went to the halfmoon diner and had lovely greasy breakfast foods. but for some reason the waitress wouldn't let me order home fries. i ordered a waffle and a scrambled egg and bacon and i wanted home fries too (I know, piggy, but I was damn hungry and I love breakfast foods). but she wasn't having it. it was so very strange. soyeah. then later we went to urlLink compusa so eric could get some cheap memory for his computer and then we dropped them off at the train station. beck, amy, and i went to my apartment quick and then were almost late getting amy back to the train station because of those damn ambiguous directions again! but we got her there... i went home for a while in the afternoon and hung out at the house for a while. i tried to take the dog for a walk but she was like the only dog ever who didn't want to walk (she's too little yet). i met beck later on for leprechaun lattes at urlLink starbucks (peppermint and chocolate syrup and green whipped cream... looked like ectoplasm oozing out of the top of our cups) and we drove around for a while. then i met carrie at urlLink price chopper for grocery shopping. monday was such a long day at work. i couldn't wait to leave. i was pretty productive though... it was carrie's first day here, and she came to lunch with meredith and me. we went to urlLink bennigan's for lunch in honor of st. patrick's day. Meredith and I ordered a pint of guinness each, and got them in el cheapo plastic cups. irritating. there was a live band playing, and they were actually pretty good. they played a whole bunch of oldies and british band songs. one of the singers sounded like he thought he was jim morrison. the food was decent. the potato soup was excellent and the reuban i had was pretty good. but the fries sucked. (they were awful, they really sucked ass). anyway. so when we got back to work i totally didn't want to stay. it was beautiful out and i was slightly buzzing (i had to end up pounding my beer because it was time to get back). but the buzz made the phone calls easier to handle so it was all good. that night i went to urlLink northern lights to see urlLink seven nations . They were awesome! They're a mix of two of my favorite genres: traditional/celtic music and rock. They have bagpipes and a fiddler. they rule. it was an awesome show. before seven nations played there were a bunch of bands, but i only saw urlLink the jimmy kelly band . they were also pretty good. they had an accordian. (that was a random little fragment. but they did. and it was cool. and who learns the squeezebox anyway? who teaches it to you? it's funny when you call it a squeezebox....) i'd see them again. anyway. i had a pretty good st. patrick's day :) also, my new computer came on that day. i set it up yesterday and it was so exciting. i now have a computer that's virtually silent. rock! i can sleep with my door open and my computer won't keep me awake! it's so sweet :) i made it transfer songs to my minidisc this morning and it was like a billion times (no kidding, really) faster than my old computer. and it didn't crash! rock! yes! yes! excellent!

so everything should be working right on the blog now ( urlLink http://aliwolly.homeip.net should be accessible, you should be able to access the Bronx Zoo pics and others that i'm hosting off of this computer and the small blogs at the top and the webcam should be operational). please, if you notice that these things are not working urlLink email me or leave a comment below. thanks!

i had dinner at Garcia's Thursday night. and our waiter at the mexican restaurant was russian. or something. his name was serge. he was very attentive, but also a little wierd. he referred to me as a senorita, which struck me as funny because we are in america at a mexican restaurant where a russian called me senorita. when he brought our dinners back to us in "to go boxes" he kept saying "don't forget to take your to go boxes" and when he brought the credit card slips back he said that one was for him and the other was "for your files." when we left, we forgot the to go boxes, but i remembered before we got outside, and it's a good thing because i think serge would've ran outside after us yelling "hey guys, you forgot your to go boxes!" last night we went to Delmonica's Italian Steakhouse. i'd never been there before. the food was good. i didn't have a steak because it was a friday during lent but my tortellini was excellent . we saw urlLink HOTD at Eamonn's afterwards. i'd never been to Eamonn's before either. it's kind of a wierd place to see a band because it's so small. the band was across from the bar and there was a row of rectangular tables between the performance area and the bar and on one end of the room there was a big screen tv that was showing one of the big basketball games (i have no interest in basketball). it was odd because everyone sitting in front of the band wasn't watching them play, they were watching the game. in fact, at one point at the end of the game, the band stopped playing and just commented on the game. and then during a commercial they played "follow me up to carlow" because the song was "only 2 minutes and 50 seconds long." after the game was over the band picked up again and played a few more songs, but they were done by 12:15. they played "Me and Julio" (Beck, I totally wanted to do "the butt dance"!) which ruled and during their encore they actually had to ask if anyone wanted to here "i used to work in chicago." that was the first time i'd ever witnessed them wanting to play that and not being screamed at to play it. but they played it :) and i was all excited because i was wearing my shirt that says "bangers" on it and they did the maine verse. yeah, it doesn't take much to excite me. they finished up with "love the one you're with." i quite enjoy listening to them play that song. the big guy rules . looks like the rest of my weekend is going to be pretty quiet. which is fine with me. i must do dishes. i suck. my entire sink is full of dishes and i completely ran out of glasses and i think the only silverware that's not dirty is one butter knife and one large spoon. but it's already quarter of six on saturday and i haven't done the dishes. ugh. i'm going to my friend justin's birthday party tonight. it's a board game party, whatever that means. i guess it means that you sit and play board games. i hope the game of life is there. that's my absolute favorite board game. i love putting the little people in the car... i heard that there will be jello shots. so that's cool. tomorrow i have to help out with state police testing. i'm excited about that. i can't wait to see dave and dr. mac again :) and it's an easy 40 bucks. sit at a table for 4 hours looking cute while all sorts of young men come out and schedule tests. :)

so my russians are at it again. i received paperwork from a lawyer who has recently been charged with a felony involving insurance fraud. great. my supervisor has contacted the Manhattan DA and told them that i'd be happy to testify if necessary. hmm. great. she volunteered me to testify against the russian mob. she said that she's testified before against them. you have to testify behind a screen. hmm. wonderful. oh well. i'd get a free trip to the city out of it.

so i went for a walk with Carrie after work yesterday, and it was so nice. i love walking. i can walk forever. but i can't run. i just can't make myself do it. suck. ah well. so after we went to dinner at Uno's and then to Borders. I found the greatest book at Borders :) it's called " urlLink are you my boyfriend? " and it's printed on board so it's like one of those baby books. very funny. Carrie and I saw this other book there called "Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus". It's a children's book, and it was completely delightful. :) it starts out with this bus driver leaving and he's asks you to watch the bus and don't let the pigeon drive it. then the pigeon comes on and starts pleading to let him drive the bus. urlLink here's an excerpt. you can just see some librarian reading this book to a bunch of 4 year olds and them yelling "NO!" at the pigeon as he's pleading to drive the bus. it's great. at one point the pigeon says "my cousin herb drives buses all the time" and then you turn the page and he says, "true story." it's great :) i should've bought it. :)

so the country drive in opened today. rock. that means summer is coming. rock! although this will be the first summer that i'll have to work full time. every day. monday through friday. all day. SUCK. i had a pretty shitty day at work today. i'm getting overwhelmed. i stayed late; almost an hour. everytime i feel like i might be making some progress i get more mail. or my supervisor brings up something in an old claim that i need to take care of. and it's ass frustrating. i think i'll keep staying late until i don't have a HUGE pile sitting in my bin anymore. beh. it'll get better. it'll be better tomorrow. i like my job. enough. i like the people i work with. a lot. but i don't think i have the right temperment for this job. i like to get stuff done and squared away. you have a task, you complete it. but with these medical claims... they can be neverending. and there's so much paperwork. applications and verification forms and bills and bills and bills. and then you have to be suspicious of everyone. and that's what gets me. i mean, i like working on the medical portion of the claims so so so much better than the car portion. it's interesting reading the files. i like reading the er notes and i'm all proud when i can "translate" the medical writing. but it sucks that people try and lie to you all the time. and there are these medical fraud rings that suck. they just suck. beh. i'll stay here for a while. but i'm not doing insurance forever. i don't know what i want to do though. i know that i want a job that's not the same thing every day. it should have flexible hours or i should be able to work from home or something because i just can't be in an office all the time. (kill me). also, i should be able to work pretty independently and be free (ok, i know this is impossible) from too much politics. and it should keep me busy because i like to be kept busy and i like to work at a fast pace and feel like i'm getting things done and helping people. so... suggestions?

beware of flying underwear so i had a nice weekend. decidedly quieter than the last few and it looks like the next few will follow suit. but that's ok with me. but i bet you're wondering about the underwear... saturday beck and i got lunch at urlLink panera and then we went over to urlLink petsmart because there was a cat adoption clinic going on. and i thought i wanted a cat (as a friend for Dude because he just seems so lonely and in need of a friend). so i spoke with two ladies at the luv a pet booth and was looking at this one little kitty named Cricket. He was adorable: black and white with green eyes... he had a lazy eye and his head was tilted. and that somehow made him more appealing. so i was saying how i'd like to take him and they made me fill out this three page application. three pages! insane! and i didn't have my landlord's number and they wanted to call him to ensure that it was ok that i had another cat. so i told them i'd get back to them with his number, but i don't have it (i suck. i had it at one time. i'm gonna have to leave a note in his mailbox to get it again). but i decided that it wasn't worth getting a cat from a place where they made you fill out a hella long application and did like background checks or something. and also, cricket was already 8 months old and therefore not a very cute little kitten. the only advantage was that cricket was already "altered". so if i get a kitten on my own (free from somewhere) i'd have to pay for the "altering". so then we went to urlLink Neemer Volkswagen which is right down the road and lusted after the incredibly cute cars. they actually had an aquarius blue (baby blue) convertable beetle that was exactly what i want the most in the world but it was sold. damn! but hella cute. i embarrassed a car salesman who told us to go ahead in the building 'cause "we don't bite" and i responded, "you don't?" so then we drove up route 9 towards Clifton Park and it was a nice day so we had both of our windows open. suddenly beck says, "i think your underwear flew out the window!" and i was like, "what?!" and i closed the windows... see, my laundry (clean) was in the back seat of my car and i had a nice pair of urlLink vicki's underwear on top and the wind blowing in the windows started stirring things up... luckily, my underwear stayed in the car but it was just so funny. i was laughing so hard i was crying (which made it hella difficult to drive). ahh.. funny stuff... good times... so yeah. i got a new jacket saturday. for about 1/2 of the original price. at urlLink american eagle . it's a light khaki peacoat with brown buttons. very cute. i think. when i first tried it on beck referred to me as inspector gadget but then later said the coat was very cute and that she wanted one for herself. i think the jacket's cute, and dodi and her friend jessica assured me that it was but i'm just a little paranoid that i look like inspector gadget every time i wear it. i saw urlLink dreamcatcher that night. the movie was pretty good, but i bet the book was a billion times better. they did a good job making it still sound like a stephen king story. the dialog was pretty much right on. but there were so many things that you could just tell were explained much better in the book. but hey, what can you do? stephen king books are so so so long and go into so much detail... there's no way you could really translate that all into a movie of any normal length. i kinda want to read the book now... before the movie they showed urlLink the animatrix , a short CG movie based on the matrix story. it was pretty cool. at the beginning there's this asian chick and this black guy fighting with swords that's pretty cool, but she ends up getting stripped down to her bra and thong (with a lot of butt shots) and that was a little unecessary. I met the usual crew for lunch sunday and Carrie and Amy made my day with a story about how my ex (tim-the-tool) went into the urlLink hollywood video where their brother, Mike, works and asked about me. Mike told him I was doing great (which I am, rock!) and Tim said that he misses me. Ha! I'm so so so the winner. He sucks. He doesn't have the right to miss me anyway. and it's funny that he does, 'cause I don't miss him at all. I am so much better off without him, and if I ever do run into him again, I'd thank him for doing me the huge favor of getting out of my life because it's a billion times better now. rock! i'm the winner!

so last night i met beck in New Paltz and we went to a benefit concert for Big Brothers/Big Sisters. Her boss is involved with the organization and gave her two tickets. Brian Vander Ark of urlLink The Verve Pipe and urlLink Bree Sharp were the musical acts. we only saw bree sharp. we got to New Paltz around 6. i got there first and was waiting for beck in the parking lot of a plaza very near the thruway. i had to pee so bad . so i started walking around the plaza looking for a place that might have a bathroom. i was out of luck. i ended up in a pharmacy at the other end of the plaza where there was a random table set up near the front where people were sitting and playing the quickdraw lotto game. how weird. anyway, so they didn't have a bathroom but they did have mint chapstick. i was overjoyed. i have been in desperate need of mint chapstick since i misplaced mine earlier this week. and every store i've gone into hasn't had mint chapstick, and that's the only flavor i like. anyway, so this place had mint chapstick out the butt. they had bins of it in the aisle where i found it and another bin of it next to the register. it's like every other place in the world that didn't have mint chapstick must've sent theirs to this pharmacy. anyway. so i bought a tube (and i haven't lost it yet!). then i went back to my car to wait for beck but i still hadn't satisfied nature's call. so i called beck desperate, and she told me to go to the mcdonald's which was right next door. i felt like such a dumbass. there was a mcdonald's right there . soyeah. afterwards i met beck in the parking lot of the mcdonalds and we sought out food. we ended up eating at this irish pub place called mcguillicudly's or something like that. we totally pigged out, but the food was good. we had "irish nachos" (waffle french fries with cheese and bacon and sour cream), reubans with french fries (beck) or onion rings (me - they were hella good), apple crisp for dessert and guinnesses. we got hysterical by the end of the meal... we weren't drunk, but we were very giggley... we started playing that little hand football game that guys in study hall used to play with paper folded into a triangle... i went to the bathroom and i was still so giggley that when someone came in and used the stall next to mine, i started to giggle to myself and i had to stay in there until they left because i couldn't stop giggling and i must've seemed crazy, so i didn't want to go out and face whoever was out there... we decided to find the studley theater (where the concert was being held... doesn't that crack you up? it sounds like you'd see a chippendales show there or something) around 8. we got lost (surprised? you shouldn't be) and ended up driving down the scariest road ever. it was all dark and suddenly it looked like we were in scary, haunted, kansas or something. beck was actually freaking out more than me for a change. we ended up back on the New Paltz campus, but we drove around for a while more before we finally decided to stop and look at a map... we found the theater and ended up arriving just about when Bree Sharp started playing. she was very entertaining. beck and i both decided that her hair rocked... the only song i knew of hers was "David Duchovny" (it's hella funny) but i enjoyed the rest of her stuff. the weird thing about the show was that it was in this auditorium that you'd normally see a play in, and it wasn't anywhere near full, so it was almost uncomfortable sitting there. everyone sat with their hands in their laps and didn't talk between songs... we didn't stay for the second guy because it was already after 9 and i had to drive home. i was on the road by quarter of 10 and i was all awake when i left, but by the time i got on the thruway i was almost passing out. i hate driving when i'm sleeping. it's so hard not to die. beh. so anyway, i didn't, i got home alive...

so my office delayed opening until 930. rock. i totally rocked the extra hour and a half of sleep. now i completely don't want to go in... beh. ah well. i'm so afraid to go outside. i'm gonna kill myself on the ice thats covering everything. i almost did last night. i tried to walk up the steps on the back porch and they were all icy and i fell forward, dropping my new white jacket in the mud and embedding little rocks all in my hands. suck.

it's a very billy joel day it's all rainy and dark outside. days like this always make me think of guard trips, especially the long ones, like, to Dayton or somewhere. i used to love napping on the bus on the way to a show. but only a tour bus (school bus trips were hell and made me want to die). we'd each get our own row of seats, and i'd shove all my crap on the floor in front of me and stretch out across the two seats. i'd always have a pillow with me, and i'd use it to lean up against the windows. i'd throw a blanket over me fold my legs up indian style on the seats (it was the only way i'd fit). it wasn't all that comfortable, but it wasn't too bad. i'd rest my cd player in a pocket of one of my bags on the floor and put my headphones on and start up Billy Joel Greatest Hits volume 1. i'd be awake for The Piano Man, and i'd start to fall asleep during Captain Jack. my absolute favorite song on that disc is New York State of Mind, and i'd always end up waking up in time to here it. I'd stare out the window at the passing highway scenes (usually very boring... some houses, mostly trees... on the way to Dayton we'd see lots of farms) and it was just so relaxing. it was a great way to spend a saturday afternoon, and welcome downtime between a stressful morning practice and a stressful/exciting/exhausting competition that evening. wow. i miss that. (great, now i've depressed myself)

so urlLink this article lists 10 foods that you should eat every week. it says you should eat fish 2 times a week. ok, i eat fish like never. then it says beans 3-4 times a week. i can handle that... fruits, veggies, whole grains, soy or conola oil (random) and low fat/non fat dairy should be eaten every day... i can handle that as well (although i suck at the veggies thing). the article says you should have alcohol every day. i can definitely handle that :) it doesn't say anything about meat though. must've been written by a veggienazi.

i really am not enjoying my job. it's not just that i'm so overwhelmed it makes me want to die and i feel like i'm drowning or suffocating in my cubicle every day. it's that i don't like the actual job. i don't like making decisions about who is at fault for an accident, and i don't like having to be suspicious of people all the time. every time anyone is injured i have to be suspicious of them. suck. today i received a demand from another company to pay them back what they paid to their insured plus their insured's deductible because they believe that our insured was at fault for the accident (this is subrogation). the police report indicates that my guy pulled out from a T intersection where he had a stop sign onto the main road making a left right in front of their girl. their girl took evasive action and swerved to avoid hitting my guy. the roads were slippery and she lost control and hit a snow bank and a chain link fence surrounding a cemetary. there was no contact between our cars. the apparent contributing factors to the accident were my guy failed to yield the right of way at the intersection and their girl got "pavement slippery" and "other vehicular". I'm thinking that we should take a big 'ol chunk of the liabilty for this one. but my supervisor says that she wants me to offer 50%. she says that their girl has a responsibility to maintain control of her car. ok, i can agree with her on that, but i don't think that makes her equally responsible for the accident. she was driving straight, doing nothing wrong, when my tool pulled out in front of her. she had a responsibility to take evasive action to avoid an accident, which she did. i'm thinking that we should take like at least 80%. i mean, if it were the other way around, i know my supervisor would tell me that we shouldn't be responsible at all. i just hate to think that i might be screwing people. i don't like it. i'm not meant to screw people.

i switched back to a live stream. the every 45 second still pictures were just never flattering. and then it'd be stuck there looking weird for 45 seconds. so now you can watch me be weird live. i have to tweak the settings. and if you get a blue screen then refresh the page (that's irritating. i have to figure out how to keep that from happening).
what the hell? it's snowing again. i hate this. it's april. it should not be snowing. this is like mother nature's april fools joke or something. whatever. fuck snow.

so have you seen the commercial for urlLink vitaball ? it cracks me up. vitaball is apparently some sort of vitamin loaded gumball which is supposed to encourage kids to want their vitamins. yeah. well, at the end the "dad" comes on and says (in this really kinda suggestive voice) "don't forget about my vitaball!" it just sounds so wrong. i laugh out loud every time i see that commercial.

so i went for a walk with my friend michelle today. we went to the colonie town park bike path and walked for about an hour and a half. it's gorgeous out today! i'm all tired and sore but i totally need to go back outside because it's just so exiting for me that the weather's actually nice again. Rock! so i decided that i'm pretty close to urlLink thatcher park , and i'd try and find directions online to go up there and walk around for a while. i found directions. but then i found this site that reviews parks, and this one woman was saying how it's unfortunate that the only time she gets to go up there is on ambulance calls and then she warns to be careful on the trails and around the falls. so now i'm like, huh, maybe i should wait until i have someone to go with. because you know i'll klutz it up and fall. beh. i'm going anyway. i still have an hour until sunset. i'm not sure i can tear myself away from the tv though. i love the 80s is on again on vh1 and it's totally sucked me in. i haven't seen this episode yet (1985). i keep cracking up and laughing like a crazy person. it's just too funny. this one guy was talking about hair and he said, "it was a bad time for america. everyone wanted to look like they were from jersey." i love movies from teh 80s. breakfast club. goonies. and my alltime favorite: back to the future. rock. 85 rocked for movies. i still haven't moved. i suck. i'm sore. my back hurts. that's not from walking though. i saw anger management last night. (did i spell that wrong? i suck.) it was a pretty good movie. better than mr. deeds. and a little random (but not random enough). adam sandler drove a saturn in the movie. it was a coupe like mine, but it was teal and it didn't have flippy lights (which i think makes it a 95). that was pretty impressive to me (i'm a dork). our seats sucked though. we were at houlihan's before and we got to the theater late and it was sold out, so we ended up sitting in the second row. so we had to basically look straight up to see the screen. i actually had to turn my head to see the side of the screen. seeing a movie that way is very odd. huh. i still haven't left to walk again. i suck. this show is just so addictive. they were just talking about pound puppies. rock! damn. it's on all night. i should leave while there are commercials on...

there was this woman that i used to work with at price chopper named colleen. col was divorced and the mother of one son, phillip. they lived with her father, and she would always talk about phil and her dad. col was always a lot of fun to work with, and great to talk to. after i left price chopper col started dating one of the guys that worked nights there. she seemed pretty happy for a while. but a couple months ago my mom told me that col was diagnosed with cancer. and today mom told me that collen shot herself last night. her father found her. she loved her dad and son so much. her dad must be so broken. i'm sure she didn't want him to find her. and her son... he's, i don't know, probably 13 or 14 now. it's just so sad.
ok. i really can't believe it's only been a little over an hour since i wrote that first post. kill me. please. this day is dragging .

so i feel bad for beck. she's been out in madison, wisconsin this week (since early sunday) for a class for work. and her flight home isn't until tomorrow afternoon. how much does that suck? and apparently madison is a big crunchy hippy town where they have demonstrations every day it's nice out. being in another city isn't so bad when you've got someone to go out with, but beck is there alone (no one else from her company had to go). so that sucks. so now she has to entertain herself tonight and tomorrow morning until she gets to come home. and the people from her class would all leave tonight, so she's really stuck there knowing no one. that just sucks.

could this day go any slower? i mean, really. i've been here for only 4 hours, but it feels like 12 at least. damn. i hate when work goes slow. it's not like i'm lacking things to do, i'm just completely not motivated to do any of it, and even if i keep busy it doesn't seem to make time go any faster today. SUCK! ugh. cannot wait to go home.

so i walked today. when i walk in albany i always start out walking on New Scotland Ave. and since i always walk in the evening, it's always pretty busy on that road (actually, it's just always pretty busy on that road). yeah. so. anyway. when i turn off of New Scotland and start walking on one of the side streets (Manning last time, South Lake this time) i always kinda get freaked out because it's suddenly so much quieter. and in a city, quiet is not comforting. i guess i really don't think anything's going to happen to me, but when i'm walking alone and i can hear someon coming up from behind, i can't help but get a little freaked out. i need to calm down, i guess. meh. i get freaked out over everything. anywho. it was a gorgeous afternoon and i very much enjoyed my walk.

(at 23. damn. i just can't wait till i'm like 70 something. i'll be a cripple.) beh. enough bitching. it's a beautiful day outside! i wish i was there! i will be in about 2 hours! rock!

so meredith had this claim where the other person's insurance company called her up and said that one of our guys hit one of their guys and they were going to subrogate to us for damages. so meredith called our guy up and he was like, "no, i wasn't in any accident" and she was like, "we're going to have to send someone out to look at your car to prove that you weren't" and the guy was like, "well, i sold that car, it's on its way to california". so she had to deny the subro claim from the other company because there was no proof that we were involved in the accident. soyeah. so today some girl from the other guy's insurance company calls meredith back and says that she talked to our guy's pastor and that the pastor told her that our guy felt guilty and confessed to him that he was in the accident. i don't know how the girl from the other insurance company came about talking to the pastor. i mean, i don't think pastors are supposed to take information that is confessed to them and go running to insurance companies or other authorities. did she call him up? i mean, isn't that some sort of violation of some code? i mean, isn't there like, some sort of confidentiality thing? like dr/patient or lawyer/client? that's just so weird! then the girl from the other insurance agency told meredith that she told the pastor to tell our guy to do the right thing and own up to the accident. like she would need to tell a pastor that. like he wouldn't know to say that on his own. weird. of course, he's talking to people about things that have been confessed to him. i dunno. maybe it's different for other religions. but i always thought that when you went to confession and confessed to a priest he couldn't go around telling people about it. huh. anyway. i thought that was weird.

so i walked out of my office today and almost ran into a urlLink verdoy volunteer fireman. he was standing out in the lobby with a urlLink colonie emt looking down the hall. when i walked outside there were two colonie ambulances, a verdoy fd ems vehicle and a verdoy car. meredith was walking out at the same time as me and said, "what's going on?" to which i responded, "an ems call" and i think she rolled her eyes at that. so later on my ride i passed urlLink st peter's hospital and there were two news trucks parked in front of it ( urlLink channel 13 and urlLink channel 10 ) and then when i turned off of new scotland ave, i saw a girl putting up a missing person poster on a utility pole. all is not right with the world.

Syracuse Cops are Stupid today one of my coworkers received a police report from Syracuse PD detailing an accident that occurred when a Syracuse police officer neglected to put his patrol car in park and it rolled out into traffic. Apparently, the police officer was parked on a hill heading down the hill and was out of his car investigating an accident. While he was out of the car, it suddenly rolled out into traffic and caused another accident. The report included two paragraphs (you never get 2 paragraphs on a police report) about why the car rolled out into traffic. The cop had put the car in reverse and thought it was in park and it sat there for a while without moving, but eventually the viscosity of the transmission fluid was changed (or something like that) blah blah blah and the car rolled out into traffic. But, the thing about it is, it's still the dumbass cop's fault because he never put the car in park. Damn, he must've felt like a real idiot. And the kicker of the whole story is, it's not just that one guy who's a dumbass because the report that we got wasn't even supposed to go to our office, they sent it to us by mistake, it was supposed to go to a Progressive office.

so i'm watching "trauma, life in the er" on TLC. i flipped the channel onto the show and the first thing i saw was this guy with a stake imbedded in his face, right through his nose. damn. he was feeding wood through a woodchipper and it kicked back on him and... damn. it's huge. and right through his right nostril. ugh. now they're cutting it down with a bolt cutter before they remove it in surgery. ugh. and it's not cutting easily... it wasn't that big. they removed it and sewed his nose back up and he's fine... the surgeon is keeping the stake. that's kind of gross. he says that he keeps the impaled items that he's removed and he already has a fence post and some rebar. gross.
