ok, so i reread the email that the seller sent me on urlLink this beetle that i love about the moonroof and i realized that i read it wrong. moonroof and sunroof are interchangeable when referring to the beetle apparently. the roof can be raised a little or open all the way for this little bug. which makes it my perfect beetle . i must own it. i can even swing the buy it now price. rock! so so so need that car. so need it. i'm going to see about getting a loan online with my dad's help tonight and the auction ends saturday. i'm placing a bid on it, but i'm worried that the reserve might not be met and i won't get it... or worse, what if someone outbids me? i keep wanting to just "buy it now" because then i'd know it will be mine (oh yes, it will be mine), but i might be able to get it cheaper by bidding. i so need that car. i freaking love the color. and it's got everything i want: turbo, sunroof, manual. rock!!!!!

so these are the beetles that i'm interested in... i love urlLink this one . it is just too cute . adorable. and it's turbo :) but it has a moonroof and not a sunroof. i want a sunroof :( but that one is so cute. urlLink this one says it has a sunroof, but i don't know if it's really a sunroof or if it's also a moonroof (note: sunroof slides open the whole way, moonroof pushes up). that one is the same color as the one that i test drove yesterday. i like the deep blue, but i think i like the bright blue of that other car a bit better. i was looking at urlLink this one as well, but i think i've ruled that one out because i'm not sure how much damage the flood actually caused, and the carfax report on it just wasn't too pretty... said it had four owners already. i'm thinking that's not such a good thing. the thing that i loved about that one was it was silver (cute!!) and it had a sunroof (awesome!!). but yeah, no. no thanks on the "reconditioned" beetle. urlLink this one is a 2001 and it's dark blue and it lists a sunroof (but again, not sure if it's actually a sunroof or if it's a moonroof), but it has scratches on the pass door. the listing states that it's an easy repair and that the dealership could do that, so i emailed them to see how much that repair would run. i don't think i'd be able to get that one though, i think the reserve price would be out of my range... i am so in love with urlLink this one . it's so cute. so freaking adorable. it's exactly what i'm looking for. turbo. sunroof. manual. 2000. red . but it has 67000 miles on it. and that's a lot . so i shouldn't go for it. dammit! so cute! so yeah. i probably won't end up with any of those. i'll never actually bid on them because i'll figure that they're out of my range or not a good deal etc. and there are new listings, like, every day. that first one is pretty much perfect, right what i'm looking for and within my range (looks like it, anyways) but it doesn't have the sunroof... and i think i need the full open sunroof. that was just too fun driving the little beetle with the sunroof open the other day... i'll probably never find the beetle i'm looking for in my price range. it's got to be at the earliest a 99. it has to be manual. i'd like the turbo beetle (because i like need to drive fast and because it just sounds cooler: "this is my turbo beetle"). i'd love a sunroof (but i guess i'd deal with just a moonroof if it came down to it... i just really want the convertible beetle above all, but i know i can't afford it, so i'd love a sunroof because it's the closest i'm gonna get to a convertible). and the acceptable colors are: silver (prob my first choice, doesn't show dirt/scratches so much), cobalt blue (that's not the official beetle name, but it's the bright blue that the first car was), indigo blue (that dark, almost navy blue - very pretty), or red (come on now, no explanation is necessary for a red car). yeah. i might go back to the vw dealership. the salesguy (dave who is bill) emailed me today: "Please let me know if I can assist you any furthur with your Beetle shopping." he was a nice guy, and i'd like to give him a commision (apparently it's slow right now) but i don't think he'd be able to make a good enough deal for me to be able to afford it. it'd be nice to buy a beetle from a dealer though. especially that one, 'cause it was a certified pre-owned with a warrenty etc. but... i don't think that was turbo ;)

so yeah. i got approved for a loan today at urlLink sunmark for $12,000 at 4.09%. how much does that rock? and i've decided to move my accounts over to sunmark because they are a credit union and they don't charge fees up the butt like urlLink fleet does. the reason why i went with fleet originally was because they had online banking and because there were fleet atms all over the place so i wouldn't have a problem finding an atm that i wouldn't pay a fee at. but sunmark has online banking with (it looks like) all the same functions that fleet has, and they also have a deal so that you can use any SUM atm 6 times a month without incurring a fee, and they have 2 atms in albany so i shouldn't have an issue (hey, as long as i have a check card, i don't need to get cash all the time). so yeah. so rock. got a car loan at a great APR, and if I use the whole amount of the loan my payments are still only $221/month and i can do that. rock. so i bid on that perfect happy blue beetle that was in queens. i made my limit $9000, but the auction ended without it ever reaching the reserve price. so even though i was the high bidder, i didn't get the car. suckage. so yeah. the seller 2000 with a turbo engine and a sunroof and it's dark blue and it's only got 11k miles on it. they're asking $15,395, but i'll be going at the end of a slow month to try and buy the beetle with a preapproved loan so i'm thinking i should be able to get a good deal on it. bill (who is dave) should be able to do good for me. i hope. i'd like to give that guy a sale. he was nice. yeah. so. and the car was nice. and that's hella low miles and i'd be getting a 2 year/24k mile warranty. and that rules. so yeah. beck and i went and test drove another beetle today. we went to cooley vw which is out by urlLink hvcc . they only had one manual new beetle, it was a yellow 1999 with 24k miles on it. it wasn't turbo and it had no sunroof and it was yellow, so i truly wasn't interested. but it's fun testdriving cars :) so yeah. the guy let beck and i take the car without coming along, so that rocked. so i drove down to this office park that's nearby that i worked in last year when i worked for measured progress through kelly temp services. we blared the music and raced through the park and beck drove for a while. beetles are fun to drive :) yeah. so... that was cool :) i brought the car back, and john (the salesguy) wanted to make a deal for me: they were asking 14 something and he said he could get it into thte 12s. but i wouldn't pay that much for that car. it was a 99, and it was yellow, and he couldn't start it right away... he had to jump it before we could drive it. in fact, he put the port-a-battery thing in the back seat so that in case we stalled the car we could jump it (which, that wouldn't have really been much help because neither of us would have known what to do with the thing had we stalled it). yeah. anyway. beetles are fun, i'm so excited that i'm getting one. my mom is also going to help me out with getting a car. dad has totally been great. he's giving me $2000 for my current car, which is generous, and he bought my stocks that i got as a graduation gift off of me and he cosigned the loan for me at sunmark. he rules . I love my daddy :) and he suggested that i ask my mom if she'd help. i didn't think she would (at all) but i guess i caught her at a good time. she just got a home equity loan and she and RJ are getting a hot tub and a sauna for their house, so she can't really cry poverty. so... i told her that dad was giving me $2000 to help me buy a car and i asked her if she'd like to help. and she said yes :) she's sending me my birthday present early. i'm not sure how much she's sending, she didn't specify ("oh, ho, ho... did not specify! never kid a kidder...) and i didn't ask. so hopefully it'll be $2000 as well. but really, anything will be a help. so yeah. so once i know what i'm getting from her i'm going to go try and get a good deal on that first bug. rock! i'm a very lucky girl. my dad definitely rules, and my mom actually came through. and i'm getting a new car at a time when it's a "buyer's market" and i got a great APR. rock! hopefully, i'll have a new car by next week. yes! yes! excellent!

dammit. south park is a repeat. i rushed home and it's a repeat. but this one's funny. stick your finger in my thresher. ew :) i need to redo the colors for this site. i don't want to look at the green anymore. maybe i'll go to white. easy to read. i like blue too... i dunno. suggestions? i think i may be ill. suckage. i haven't been feeling right, and i felt my neck to see if my glands were swollen and they are. well, the right one is. and that feels gross. like a marble or something. ew. i should go to bed. i went for a walk today while i did my wash at the parents' house. when i'm "up north" i like to walk in the vischer ferry preserve because i can walk there alone without feeling like i might get jumped and the route i take takes me about 70 minutes to walk when i walk fast, so it's a nice "workout". today it completey tired me out. my legs are so tired. if i was smart and stretched before and after i walked i wouldn't feel this way. while i was driving home i thought that i'd do pilates or yoga when i got here to stretch my legs out, but now i'm just too lazy. i'm just going to go to bed.

so tonight is matrix night and i'm all excited. we have tickets for the 11pm show at crossgates. which means that we'll have to be in line by at least 10. damn. that's sucky. the guy that i bought beck's tickets from said that the lines will form an hour to an hour and a half ahead of time. damn. and that was for the 6pm show tomorrow that she's going to. 11 tonight will probably be worse... damn. anyway, so i'm all excited and beck's giving me a hard time because i'm going to see it without her and i broke our "pact" (we're gay... we were supposed to go see x-men and the matrix together... but i sorta did break it...) but she's got someone to see it with tomorrow so it's all good. beh. look at me ramble on about this. i can't concentrate at work today. it's warm in here and stuffy and too quiet. suck.

so it's all about the bathroom today. when i was in the bathroom (for like the 5th time already today, i'm a peeing freak) i heard some woman exit the stall, turn on the faucet, run her hands under quickly, turn off the faucet, pull out a paper towel, and leave. ew. there was no soap involved in that process and that is gross. i could tell that there was no soapage because there was no pumping action. not before the faucet turned on. and there was no break in the sound of the water to indicate that she would have run her hands under the water, taken them out to soap up her hands, and then returned them to the water for rinse. ew. all i'm saying is what's the point of running your hands under the water without the soap? gross. this is how diseases are spread: improper handwashing.

i'm so vain. i probably think this song is about me. so when i was at the hair salon saturday waiting while beck got her hair done i realized that i could never work in a hair salon. or any other place that has a lot of mirrors. or really reflective windows for that matter. when there is a reflective surface around, i must be staring at myself in it. i'm like, fascinated by my reflection. when i drive and i stop at lights/stop signs/whatever i'm always flipping down my visor and opening up the mirror and checking out my hair etc. i just got back from the bathroom where i spent an extra 10 minutes in there staring in the mirror. i am so glad i have a hair appointment tonight because my hair is just disgusting right now. it's all bushy at the ends. ew. i have a blue shirt on today and it really brings out my eyes. i rock. :) i will rock much more when my hair is cut and not bushy/shaggy. i used a new self tanner on friday from bath and body works. it had a bronzer in it so i could tell where i was putting it. the result was much better than my last attempt with the neutrogena self-tanner that didn't have bronzer in it (i was streaky... very bad). but i didn't moisterize before i put the tanner on and i wasn't so good about moisterizing the last few days and now my dry skin on my legs is getting back at me. if you look closely you can see the cracks in my skin. i look like a cracked desert. it's pretty bad. beh. i guess the only way to get tan legs that look natural is to let the sun get 'em or to go tanning. but i'm afraid of the cancer. i bet the vanity wins out on this one though. i was at express this weekend and the one salesgirl was wearing a short skirt and her pale, pasty, white legs just looked so gross... i wanted to vomit. or hand her pants. so i'll need to get color on my legs somehow before i start wearing shorts or skirts because i don't want to cause that reaction in other poeple.

tuesday i met beck in new paltz for dinner at the urlLink gilded otter . on tuesdays if you show them your tattoo you get 10% off. so rock! it's a brewing company, so we ordered their "beer garden" which was a collection of 9 shot glasses filled with the beers that they were currently brewing. we sampled, and determined that the really dark ones were really good, the darker ones were ok (i liked them better than beck did) the light ones tasted like perfume or suntan lotion or coors light (gross) and the red one tasted like Killian's Irish Red. I ordered one of the really dark ones, the Chief Maytaysay (?) Porter. it was great, strong and then at the end you could taste coffee and chocolate. i really enjoyed it. beck ordered their copper ale, the red one, and she enjoyed hers as well. the food, unfortunately, was not as good as the beer. our appetizer was pretty good, but the main course was just ok. i had a portabella and eggplant sandwhich which was pretty bland. beck's pizza rustica was ok though. we had creme brulee cheesecake for dessert, which sounded better than it was. the caramel on top was like a skin, not crunchy like you'd expect. beck enjoyed hers better than i enjoyed mine. at the end of the meal we almost didn't show our waitress our tattoos to get 10% off. i'd told beck that she'd have to handle that, and she did ask the waitress what it was all about. she said that if you could show her a tattoo before she brought the check she'd take 10% off. then she almost immediately brought the check. but before we paid she came back and asked us if we had tattoos or if we were joking before. because apparently we don't look the type to have tattoos i guess. so i said, uh, yeah, and showed her mine. then she looked at beck and asked her if she had the same one. beck said no and showed her hers. after the waitress left we discussed how she apparently thought we were gay. why does everyone assume we're gay? i don't think we put off the gay vibe or look gay (if there's a gay look). people apparently think that all the time. what the hell? anyway. so then we walked around new paltz because it was a pretty nice night. we laughed at a kid who rode his bike into a pole because we're mean (well, we were laughing before it happened and then it did happen and beck said. "don't laugh, don't laugh" which is really the best way to get me to laugh, so we became hysterical and then felt a little mean afterwards).

monday was an interesting day. i woke up at 8:20. i looked at the clock and thought, "what day is it? it can't be monday, i'd be at work. it must be sunday. but wait, sunday i was in pennsylvania." so i picked up my cell phone and looked at the time/date display and saw that it was monday. i freaked out, jumped out of bed and pretty much ran around in a circle before i got my head together and called Mary Ellen to tell her that i just woke up and that i'd be in asap. i felt like such a tool... work sucked that day. it always does. i hate my job. that evening i decided to go for a walk because it was only supposed to be nice out monday and tuesday and then the rest of the week looked like it was going to suck. so i packed my laundry in the car before work and headed for my parents' house directly from work. the gas light came on in my car on the way home, but i forgot to stop, so i figured i'd get gas when i went for my walk. i started my laundry and then headed out for the preserve in vischer ferry. i had a nice walk and i finished up around 830. i got in my car and headed towards the parents' house so that i could collect my laundry and go home. i proceeded up the hill from the village on vischer ferry road and suddenly my car wouldn't accelerate. i'm like, "oh my god! what's happening! this is a new car! aaauuuggghh!" so i rolled over to the side of the road on the way up the hill in a pretty shitty spot to have your car stop working because it was just around a curve and proceeded to freak out. i called my dad and said that my freaking car stopped working and i was really pissed and i didn't know what was wrong with it, perhaps it was the battery and could he come get me please and hurry because this was embarrassing. he asked if i had enough gas and i admitted that the gas light had come on but that the little indicator wasn't all the way to the empty... he said he'd be down so i sat there and waited with the four ways on hoping that no one i knew would drive by and that no one would stop to help me because that would just embarrass the shit out of me. dad showed up with a can of gas and poured some in my tank... and the car started. again that day i felt like such a tool. who runs out of gas? apparently this girl does. so dad and i went up to the stewart's on the corner of vischer ferry and grooms road and we both filled up our tanks and then when we were leaving i noticed that there was a spider on the roof of my car near my sunroof which was popped open to vent. i freaked out and yelled for my dad to get it off because if it crawled in the sunroof i was going to die. he brushed the vile little monster off the roof and pointed out that it was the second time tonight he'd saved me then he got in his car and i got in mine and we both headed home. so i'm driving down (well, i guess up really, i was heading north) vischer ferry road following my dad home and i notice movement on the driver's side of my windshield. there was a spider crawling there. i was immediately grossed out and went to close my vented sunroof so that he could not get in at me when i realized that the spider was inside . i completely freaked out. "it's inside, it's inside, it's inside, it's inside" was all i could say over and over again. i tried to call my dad in front of me so that he could save me for a third time that night but he had the cell phone turned off. the spider crawled across the windshield to the passenger side, crawled onto the dash and proceeded to crawl at me. at this point i lost all rational thought and reason. i slammed on the gas and braked. i swerved all over the road. i flashed my high beams at my dad in front of me trying to get his attention. and all the while i was now screaming , " it's inside! it's inside! it's inside! it's inside! " i swerved into the ghetto chopper parking lot, took the car out of gear, yanked up the e-brake, unbuckled my seatbelt and pretty much fell out of my car. i turned around to look inside so that i wouldn't lose track of the spider (really, the worst thing ever is when a spider is attacking you and you lose track of it. then you don't know where the heinous little fucker is and what it's doing. it could be crawling on you. and that would be, well, i think i'd have to die). it was sitting on my dash above the vent near the steering wheel staring at me. it had come so close to getting on me. ew. ew. ew. ew. ew. ew. ew. ew. i tried to call my dad again, but the phone was still turned off. i called beck who advised that i kill it. well, if it were that easy, i would've just done it while i was driving. but for some reason i freeze up when i try to kill spiders. i'm so freaked out by them. i for some reason think that if i try and kill it that i will miss and that it will then jump on me or run at me. oh god, ew. that would be awful. anyway, so i looked around the parking lot and couldn't see anyone who i thought i could ask for help (it would've come to that had i seen someone who i thought would help me, i don't care that it sounds crazy). so i figured i had to kill it otherwise i'd be stuck there in a face off with the spider. i had sandels on the passenger seat that i wore to work that day. i couldn't reach across from the driver's side because then the spider would jump on me, so i ran around to the passenger side, retreived a sandel, determined that i could not try to kill it from that side because i might miss and risk losing it in the car or having it attack me, so i ran back to the driver's side and tried to psych myself up for killing it. i attempted a couple times and stopped and freaked out. and then finally i just slammed the sandel down on the spider and imediately withdrew from the car into the parking lot where i jumped around and freaked out because i had been that close to the spider. i peeked back into the car and saw no body. ew. there was juice on the dash, so i was pretty sure that i'd at least hit it, but i had no physical proof that i'd killed it. i was grossed out by the juice, so i ran into the ghetto chopper and bought some windex wipes which i used to wipe the juice off the dash. when i was done wiping the dash i took the wipe by a corner and held the spider juice wipe out in front of me while i took it to the garbage can. on the way back, i noticed that the car that was near mine wasn't empty. there were four guys sitting in the car watching my freakout. i felt like a tool for the third time that day. after i convinced myself that it was dead or at least mortally wounded even if i didn't have the proof right in front of me, i got back in the car and headed home. i was so grossed out though and tried to touch as little of the car as i could because i didn't want to risk touching either a half dead spider or a spider carcass. i got home and told the parents what happend and they seemed to think it was no big deal. whatever. spiders are scary.

so i haven't updated much lately. i've been busy at work and then after work i've been doing stuff or not but what i've not been doing is sitting in front of my computer. which is good and bad. good because, well, damn, it's good to have a life and not sit in front of the computer all the time. bad because i just bought this freaking computer and i'll be paying for it for a while and i pay like $50 a month for the roadrunner service and so i should really get my money's worth out of both. anywho. i'm going to bed now (because it's freaking 240am and i've got to drag my ass into work in the morning), but i expect that i'll be able to update sometime tomorrow earlyish evening... so sorry for the lackage of updates and thanks for looking, and if you want to read some new stuff please check back later. : )

so i went to PA this weekend for my cousin's first communion. i totally did not want to go because it seemed that fun things were going on around here and all i had to look forward to was spending time with my mom and RJ (stepfather) and i don't like them very much. they just irritate the shit out of me. the weather sucked while i was down there. of course the weather up here was gorgeous the whole weekend. whatever. ugh. i was so happy to be home sunday.

so i got a friend for dude. i'm not sure that he appreciates it though. i picked out a little kitten from the animal shelter in ballston spa with the help of two of my little brothers. she's a little 8 week old tortise shell kitty. she's very pretty. dude is not too happy about our little addition though. hopefully he'll get used to her at least. he seemed ok with her until she used her litter box. i guess another cat is ok in the house as long as this cat is not crapping in his house. i haven't named the new little cat yet. i keep referring to her as little one or baby. i gess she needs a name. she's very pretty, so i was thinking that she needed a grownup name. but nothing seems to fit...

i'm thinking that, upon approval from beck, i'll be reserving a room at one of the hostels at urlLink hostelworld.com . i was originally looking at urlLink avalon house , but it doesn't appear that we could get a room with an attached bathroom and i'm pretty sure that's a dealbreaker for beck. and really, it's only $3 more than a private without. so i'm thinking that we should definitely stay at urlLink Jacob's Inn . the prices are the same as avalon house, and they have a prettier website (and really, that's the important part, isn't it?). actually, Jacob's Inn looks like it'll be our best bet. $40 per person per night for a private room with a bathroom attached. sounds good to me.

i've been trying to find hotels in ireland. i've been looking mostly at hostels b/c they are cheap and private rooms are possible. i read a review at urlLink tripadvisor.com of mount eccles hostel which said, "Went to MEC for St.Patricks 2003. We stayed in a 6bed dorm on the second floor. The place was secure with electronic card entry and storage lockers. It also took mastercard which was a plus. The showers sucked, very cold water dribbled out, but it wasnt that big of a deal. The buses to the airport drop off and pick up only 5 minutes away. Its in a slightly sketch part of town, but all in all I would say its a fine place to stay for the price." at first i cracked up at the review b/c it said the showers were cold and dribbley but that wasn't a big deal b/c damn, i don't want to take cold showers. then i realized that the review sounded like something i totally would have written, i mean, the language was very similar to my own (word usage: sucked, slightly sketch). so i looked up and saw that the review was written by someone from albany. i was amused.

so last night was fun. beck and i met up with her friends from poughkeepsie at the big house in albany. it seems that people who work in poughkeepsie come from the capital district originally, so that's why they were up here. beck and i got there at about 1030 and the drinking commenced. we were told that we had a lot of catching up to do as they'd already had "as many as four "... those guys were pretty cool. somehow i got ass drunk and didn't end up spending any money. being a girl rules. i had their "prohibition porter" (big house is a brewing company) and it was pretty good. there was a girl there on her bachelorette party with her sister and her friend. she had blow pops tied around her waist sticking out of her pants and a shirt that said "tonight i better get kissess because one day soon i'm gonna be a missus". the shirt was one of those tiny t's from express, so it had this baby pocket on it in which she had hershey kisses. her friend was bringing her around telling people that they could take a blow pop out of her pants with their mouth for a dollar. so we all did that. when you paid her she'd pull down her shirt so that you could put the dollar in her boobs and she was like, "you can put it in there with your mouth" and i was like, "um, no thanks". the girl was actually pretty nice and she and her friend hung out with us for a while. then she went and got her younger sister who she said had bigger boobs than her and she brought her over to the table so that she could hook up with one of the guys. the guy that she ended up leaving with was the only single guy at the table and apparently it's been a while or something like that. and, damn. good for him for leaving with that girl because i was lead to believe it's been a very long time. but yeah. beck says that's because he's really picky, so i guess that's his fault. dumbass. got ass drunk. we had chocolate cake shots. i have no idea what was in them, but they smelled just like chocolate cake. they looked like pee though. but they tasted alright. after you did the shot you sucked on a lemon dipped in sugar. like it was the icing. pretty good. anyway. so yeah. drunk funness. i feel that there was more i was going to write about, but i can't remember.

oh, so i named my car. i decided that it's definitly a boy and that it should be a german name. and i was thinking Hansel because Hansel was a fat little kid in Hansel and Gretel. But he didn't really look like a Hansel or a Hans. Alex suggested that I name the car after the fat German kid in Willy Wonka. so i looked up that name, and the kid from Willy Wonka was Augustus. And i really like that name for my car. Augustus. Gus. I like Gus... like that little fat mouse in Cinderella that laughed... Gus Gus. rock.

so i got a little turbo thingy for the back of my car. see, my little beetle is a turbo beetle. people who know beetles can tell that by the retractable spoiler just above the rear windshield. but it didn't have any markings on it to denote that it's turbo. and the other day i was behind someone whose beetle had a little turbo thing on it right below the VW emblem on the back of the car. i was so jealous. my little beetle is turbo too and no one could tell. so i went home that day and ordered one of those little turbo thingys off of ebay for $10. yesterday i spent an hour and a half vaccuming out the inside, armoraling the interior, washing the outside, waxing the outside, washing all the windows and washing the tires. my car is so spiffy and beautiful now. then i stuck the turbo thingy on the back under the VW emblem. I was so nervous about putting it on, because i didn't want it to be crooked. it came with a backing over the sticky part and a clear cover over the front to keep it shiny. i kept the clear part on when i was sticking it to the car because it was something easy to hang on to and it was rectangular so i figured that it would help me get it on straight. so i held on to the edges of the clear cover and leaned toward the car trying to get it as centered and as straight as possible, and suddenly i realized that i'd leaned too close and it was stuck to the car. i think it may be tilted just a little bit, but that might be me being hypercritical and i don't think that anyone else looking at the car would think it was. also, because the car's so round, it looks tilted different ways from every direction. so it's probably as straight as anyone could have got it. so rock. my car is hella cute. and now everyone knows it's a turbo beetle.

ended up going to see hotd tonight at mcgeary's. beck and i met her friends at the hill street cafe before hand. but they ended up not coming with us to mcgeary's. we had a good time though. it was the first time i saw hotd sober, and they still ruled. the crowd there sucked though. they didn't know the band or the songs and some of them were actually rude/drunk enough to boo. i wanted to kick this guy's ass so bad because he kept yelling "you suck". that kid sucked. the kids didn't know how to dance to the irish music (apparently if music doesn't have a big thumping bass line they don't know how to dance to it) and some kids were actually grinding, which was kind of disturbing. but the band was great and they played "johnny jump up" and "me and julio" and "cecilia" and "paddy murphey's wake" and "mary mac" and it was wonderful. i so love hotd. we only stayed for a little while because beck had to drive back to poughkeepsie. i wore my awesome pink underwear under a hot pink baby t-shirt from express and a denim skirt. apparently pink really works for me. i got hit on by this guy named "packy". he came over and introduced himself and i thought he said, "i'm packing" and i was very confused. but it turns out that his name was packy and that his real name is gaelic and no one could pronounce it so they called him packy instead. weird. anyway... then later this other guy was apparently checking me out (according to beck) but his whole tactic was apparently to stand right near me and bump into me. anyway. it was a good night out, and pretty confidence boosting as the last few times i went out i didn't get hit on at all and i was beginning to think that i was the ugly chick.

so tonight urlLink hotd is playing at urlLink mcgeary's right after urlLink alive at five . and i totally want to go. but alex is working (suck) and beck lives far away (suck) and meredith has to wash her dog (come on, now) and urlLink dodi is going tanning and i'm not sure what's she's up to afterwards, and Carrie is sick (otherwise i think she and her scottish man would appreciate hotd.... they'll have to come out sometime this summer). so anyway. really wanna go. haven't seen hotd in forever .

so my burn between the girls is very pink. of course, it could be a reflection of the hot pink bra i'm wearing. i keep going to touch it because my hands are cold to cool it down, but then i realize that at work that doesn't look so nice... so i forgot to preorder the new harry potter book and i'm very upset. i want it. i can't wait to read it. all i'm sayin' is, it's only going to take me about a day to read it (yes, i know it's like 900 pages... i'm a fast reader and kind of a dork, i'll devote an entire day to reading) so if anyone gets a copy they should give it to me first because i'll be done with it quickly... today is exactly four weeks from my birthday (july 17). so that means it's time to shamelessly promote my urlLink wishlist ... love me but don't know what to give me? find perfect stuff urlLink here ...

so i went tanning for the first time ever today and this is what i learned: 1) not all girls that work in health/beauty stores in clifton park are snotty. the girls at sunsations were actually very nice. 2) tanning is very relaxing. they have a (car) radio built into the bed so you can either bring a cd along or tune into whatever you want to listen to. 3) i am not as claustrophobic as i thought because i didn't freak out when i lowered the top of the bed (which looks like a funky futuristic coffin on a stand) 4) i burn easiest in a place i never knew: right between my breasts. annoying. 5) make sure that your undergarments (if you choose to wear them) are not crooked when you lay down to tan... odd tan lines result... 6) the sun "don't shine" there for a reason... cause if it gets burnt... ouch ... yeah. so i actually saw a difference after the first time (and i only was in there for 8 minutes) so i think i'm going to go again. i definitely don't want a dark tan like the girls that worked there had, but i'd like to obtain and maintain some color. after i saw that girl at express a couple of months ago wearing the miniskirt and scaring people with her pasty white legs i decided that i cannot look like that and since my job prohibits me from being out in the sun (damn the work week... and damn the constantly rainy weekends!) i'll have to get my color by tanning. (because, yeah, i tried the self tanner thing, and i kind of suck it up every time and i ony do it on my legs because i shudder to think of how badly i could fuck it up on my arms/chest/face, and besides it doesn't last very long). so now i guess i'm a high maitenance girl who tans. ah well. i'm a pretty, pretty princess. i own that.

"what, like the back of a volkswagen?" so i (finally) went to apply for my passport during my lunch and when i went to get back in my car i looked down and noticed that right next to the door behind the driver's seat was my pack of listerine fresh strips or whatever they're called. then i looked to my left a little and saw the side of a black box stuck between the driver's seat and the door. i thought that it looked like a black deck of cards box that my brothers use at home. i reached down and dug it out and discovered that this was no deck of cards... it was a 3 pack of durex condoms. they were "colored and scented" strawberry, orange, and (this kills me) banana. these were not mine. i was kind of shocked. they must have been from the previous owner of the car. the box was unopened (i think had it been opened it would have been gross). immediately all i could think of was the line from mallrats, "he likes to have sex in a very uncomfortable place." "what, like the back of a volkswagen?" (and really, with the cloth tan seats, you'd have to use 'em or else you could stain... ew, that was graphic, sorry...)

to continue on with the events of the weekend... friday i didn't end up going out. the plan was to go out, but plans did not happen. i ended up sitting at home waiting for half the night for said plans to happen before i aborted on that and went and hung out with urlLink eric and ryan. we bummed around for a bit. eric and ryan were planning on playing gt3 because they had 2 ps2s, 2 tvs, and eric was going to bring up his copy of gt3 and the i-link so that they could play 2 player not split screen (instead using the 2 tvs). but eric forgot his copy of the game and also the i-link. getting an additional copy of the game was easily solved with a trip to hollywood video. but unfortunately another i-link was difficult to come by at 11pm on a friday night. so eric and ryan played "my street" while i watched (was too tired to play... had only 4 hours of sleep the night before then went to work etc). i finally was too tired to be awake anymore so i went home (and drove off the road at one point... hit a pothole, which woke me up and scared the crap out of me but fortunately did no damage to Gus). Saturday was cool. went to the mall with beck. we were going to go test drive jettas (she's eventually going to buy one), but we ran out of time. beck had to go to a barbeque that night at her friend's house (it was his birthday) and then she convinced Alex and I to join them at a bar in Catskill. originally they were planning on going out in Albany, but another friend suggested this bar in Catskill so the plan changed. i was not into going to a bar in catskill when there are good bars in albany and also urlLink hair of the dog was playing in Saratoga. but we went. the bar was pretty nice. it was all outdoors by the river and you could watch boats go by and it was a nice night, and if it had been located in saratoga or lake george it would have ruled. but, unfortunately, it was located in catskill. and there were like 15 people there when our group got there and then by like 1030 almost everybody left. i guess it was bed time in booneyville. god, i'm mean. anyway... so we ended up going back up to albany to the big house. (and i didn't say i told you so. ok, until just now.) it ended up being a good night out. i quite enjoyed the music at the big house and the drinks weren't bad either... :)
so much work to do. buried. cannot breathe. suck.

so... Thursday was fun. well, work wasn't. but after work was. we went to urlLink "Alive at Five" in Albany. it was the first celtic night, and they had a band from texas, urlLink the kildares , playing. the band kind of sucked. i mean, especially compared to all the awesome new york celtic bands (hello urlLink hair of the dog ). there were tons of people there. it was at the rain location which was underneath the I-787 overpass at the Corning Preserve. no one really knew how to get there, so you just had to follow all the other young people dragging coolers of beer. we had our beer in a backpack because "you're supposed to drink it so fast that it doesn't get cold." the beer i bought kind of really sucked. see, you weren't supposed to bring glass containers, so i went for cans. and then i thought, "ew, these can beers are ghetto" so i bought the least ghetto beer in a can, amstel light. well, ew. amstel light from a can pretty much just tastes like the can. aluminum beer. nasty. anyway. so we walked around till we bumped into some people that Alex used to work with at Albany Med and we ended up going to dinner with them at the urlLink bayou cafe . i'd never been there before. it was a little crowded and the band they had there that night kind of sucked (i mean, they weren't terrible but...). the food was good. i had a veggie burrito. it was huge and very spicey, but my gin and tonic took care of that. afterwards we headed over to urlLink mcgeary's where the urlLink chad lamarsh band was playing. they were decent. a pretty good cover band. the lead singer took his guitar and walked from the tent outside into the bar and then back outside again and stopped right in front of where we were standing while he was doing a Rush cover. it was amusing. a little uncomfortable, having the performer right there in front of you. like, there's pressure there, having the performer right in front of you. you really feel like you have to look like you're paying attention and like you're enjoying what they're doing. anyway. we only stayed there for one drink (i couldn't decide what to have so i asked the bartender to surprise me, and i got a stoli orange and tonic with a splash of grenadiene <-spelled that wrong i think. it was pretty good. i wonder if it has a name...). Then we headed home. good night out though. :)

went to see Charlie's Angels Full Throttle tonight. Meredith's friend got free passes to a screening from his job, but he couldn't use them so Meredith invited me and Carrie and her boyfriend. the movie was a lot of fun. hell to get in though. for some reason the studio set up a security check at the door to the theater, so we got there at 7 but they didn't start the movie till 830 because it took forever to get people through the security check and into the theater. in fact, i guess they turned like 100 people away at 830 because they just wanted to start the movie. we got in though, so that's all that matters to me. ;) anyway, the movie was very unrealistic but extremely entertaining. totally makes you want to kick butt. i wanna be an angel when i grow up. it was so nice to sit in the air conditioned theater for three hours. the movie was only like an hour and a half long, but i really didn't mind waiting for it to start. i don't have a/c here at the apartment. and i think i'm melting now that i'm back here. i think i'm the only fool who doesn't have an air conditioner. i really need one. i just want a small one for my bedroom so that i can sleep at night. this humidity is unbearable. i think i'm going to take a cool shower before i try and go to sleep. ugh. this sucks. i just checked the forecast and tomorrow is supposed to be hot and very humid again. but starting tomorrow night we're supposed to get a break in the humidity and the temperature is supposed to drop a bit... ugh. i hope that happens. it's heinous to be in my apartment in this weather.

so sleepy... must resolve to not only get 4 hours of sleep before going into work again... suck... went home to wish my little brother a happy birthday on the day of his party. his birthday was actually on the 17th. i hung out with my dad for a little bit, watched star trek... then i went tanning (burnt between the girls again... dammit. it's all red and itchy...) and then i washed my car. i used my parents' old vaccum cleaner because it didn't cost me $1 to use it and because it has this tiny power head on it so i could really clean my floor mats. rock. then i used these special wipes to get all the bug carcasses off of the hood and mirrors (and later, after i drove the car in the summer night it was coated with bugs again. yuck.) i washed the car at the mobil across from salty's. after i was done washing it i was drying it off when this guy pulled up in front of the bay and shouted, "you're beautiful! i love you!" i looked down at myself: sweaty, shorts falling off, tank top stuck to me and riding up... i felt like i was all hanging out disgusting looking. he apparently thought different. i said, "thank you" and went back to drying my car. odd. after that i was so hot and i wanted ice cream. the country drive in was closed (9 is too early to close!) so Alex and I went to Jumpin' Jack's. and then drove around because the air coming through the windows and sunroof felt so nice. later on we ended up going to Denny's where we discovered they have tiny hamburgers. they are adorable. they're like regular burgers cut into quarters or something. but they look like they're own little individual tiny burgers. adorable. anyway. i didn't get home until 2 and then i couldn't not at least start Harry Potter, so i didn't get to sleep 'till 3. but i still got up on time this morning, so rock.

oh. my. god. urlLink this made me laugh so hard . and now i'm sitting here at work trying to look like i'm not goofing off and my face is all red and i have tears in my eyes and i keep having these little eruptions of aftershock giggles. the animation is just too great . so freaking funny.

I'm a pretty, pretty princess. i'm so very Charlotte from Sex and the City . well, i'm dressed like her today, anyway. i'm wearing a lavender twin set with white trim. it's a tube top with a bow in the front and a sweater. and i'm wearing it with my skirt from the gap that's khaki colored and very cute. and i've got my strappy brown sandals on. and i have my crystal cross necklace, crystal earrings, and a crystal toe ring (that's my favorite part). i love dressing up. in other news... Carrie bought me the new Harry Potter book for my birthday. and she gave it to me today because she knew that making me wait until my birthday for it would be cruel. she handed it to me on the way into work this morning. i should have just stuck it in my car right away, but i carried it inside and now it's sitting next to me on my desk. and it's calling to me. it's saying, "ali, read me, do it. work is boring. i am not." damn the Harry Potter book. it's arguement is just infallible.

ok, so the plan was to get home and clean. was gonna clean the bathroom. was gonna clean the kitchen. was gonna put away assloads of laundry. was gonna clean the floors. but what i did do was get home and throw myself on the love seat in the living room. this is my favorite spot during the summer because the living room is shaded so it doesn't get too hot in there, and there are two huge windows that a very nice breeze comes in. so the loveseat is the coolest place in the apartment in the summer. i may end up sleeping there some nights. perhaps i should rearrange the living room so the sofa is in that spot and i can spread out... yeah. so anyway. i took a nap from about 5:15 to about 6:50. then i made dinner (couscous) and ate. then at about 8 i decided to watch the ring . i hadn't seen it yet. everyone said it was so scary. i didn't really think so. ok, well, i cheated. i watched probably about a third of the movie on mute. yeah. i've watched south park and the real world since then, so i'm hoping i don't have any lingering images when i go to bed. i did do dishes. and i might put away some laundry... it's hot and i hate being hot. i need an air conditioner. i don't really have an exterior window to put one in though... i wonder if it's ok to put one in my bedroom window if it vents into an enclosed porch... do air conditioners emit that much exhaust? maybe i just need to move to a place with central air... too bad i'm poor and i really can't afford to spend any more a month than i currently am... suck. (whining moment:) awww!!! hot!!! uncomfortable!!! dammit!!! stupid little cat was just on the desk and falling and knocked a huge pile of papers off. little cat is stupid and annoying. she keeps me up at night by attacking my feet. and in the morning (and pretty much all the time) she's up in my shit. i have to constantly watch her. she's always getting into shit. constanly in the garbage can. i lit candles the other day and she kept sticking her nose in the candle. dumbass. i used to think i watned kids. but i can't handle a kitten. i can't imagine how i'd handle a kid....

yet again, another beautiful day. and i'm stuck inside at work. i can't work these hours. i need a more flexible job. or i need to be independently wealthy. my supervisor always tells me to marry for money. "you can always learn to love 'em." i am ass poor. i hate being ass poor. i hate working. beh. (sorry. had a whining complaining moment, i'll stop now). so i cannot wait to go home today and clean! (not really, but i'm trying to fool myself into being excited about it). when i came to on the bathroom floor after fainting on saturday (and after i realized where i was) all i could think was, "gross! i'm on my bathroom floor! i really need to clean this..." so that's the task for the afternoon. clean bathroom. clean kitchen. put away assloads of laundry. wash floors. of course, it's probably going to be hot and uncomfortable so i'll just end up sitting around. i went swimming last night at dodi's house. it was fun, but very very cold. you got used to it once you got the girls in. i had to borrow a swim suit. all she had was a tankini. i was like, um, no. i don't need to be disgusting people. and she was like, dude, it's just us. so i tried it on, and i actually liked it. i did not look like a huge fat ass like i thought. and you could see the tattoo. i think the fact that i'm getting tan is helping the whole me in a swimsuit issue that i have. rock. tans rock. work does not rock. but i better get back to it. sigh.

so i was fine the rest of the weekend. i mean, healthwise. no more fainting. today i feel very odd. it seems that i need to eat every 2 hours or else i get a headache. so i ate at 10 (oatmeal) then i ate about 1230 (a lean cuisine) and now i suddenly feel weird. the headache went away but now i feel like my face is heavy. and i feel very weak. i almost feel like if i tried to do anything i might faint again. hmm. this better stop soon. i hate being damaged. also, i've decided to not write about this anymore because it's boring and no one wants to read you complaining.

albany is going to hell... shooting in my neighborhood, spider in the fruit... albany is going to hell. ew. i don't want to live in albany anymore or eat the fruit. god, that's so gross. i can't get over that. what if she hadn't looked? she could have been bitten and then fallen over and the spider would have crawled out and found a spider to mate with and produce horrible little mutant killing spiders like in arachnaphobia . EW!!!! meredith just told me that there was an egg sack in the grapes as well. horrible. just freaking too disgustingly horrible to think about. what if she'd reached down and grabbed the egg sack instead of a grape and ate that?! i'm so skeeved out... ew.... ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew...

spider in the fruit... oh. my. god. i am never buying desert fresh grapes. or really, any grapes. ew ew ew ew ew. some woman bought a bunch of grapes at the BJ's wholesale club in albany and she brought them to work for coworkers to eat and when she opened the container she found a black widow spider in it. EW!! ugh. urlLink here's an article about it . ohmygod. i would die if i looked into my container of grapes and saw a black widow in it. i think i'd fall over. or throw the container. which is heinous because the spider would definitely get out. and then try to eat me.

shooting in my neigborhood... so yesterday i went to my parents' house after work. the six o'clock news came on and their lead story was that of a shooting in an otherwise quiet albany neighborhood. the shot behind the news correspondent looked familiar and i said, "that better not be my neighborhood" and then the correspondent said that the shooting occurred in the Pine Hills neighborhood of Albany and i said, "that is my neighborhood." apparently yesterday at 5:30 in the morning this guy was getting home from work and was parked on New Scotland Ave near Norwood Street (the next street over from my street) when two men approached his car and asked for a cigarette. they may or may not have struggled after that and the man got shot in the chest. the two attackers took his wallet and his car and left the guy on the street. the guy crawled out to the street and waved down a passing ambulance (there are many, many ambulances on New Scotland all the time because St Peter's is on one end and Albany Med is on the other) who took the guy to Albany Med. I guess he survived. This is very freaky though. shootings in your neighborhood are not good. scary. and my lease is up at the end of this month and i just got the new one to renew it... i was thinking of moving before the shooting and i started thinking of it again after i heard about that, but i really don't think i'd be able to get my ass in gear and find a new place for about the same amount of money that would allow me to move in at the beginning of August... so beh. you can read the urlLink times union article about the shooting urlLink here .

so again i was working at a good pace getting a lot of stuff done today when suddenly my concentration left me and i couldn't do a thing. so i decided to see who was playing at urlLink mcgeary's this week. and on the 4th there's this band called urlLink enter the haggis playing. rock that name. they're a celtic rock band, which really sounds interesting. they have pipes and everything. and from the urlLink pictures on their site they look like they put on a fun show. they have sound clips on their site but as i am at work and do not have speakers on my computer i cannot listen to them. they have a pretty cool site altogether. i really enjoy the format of their urlLink picture page . i'd love to do something like that for my photo album... that's something to think about... anyway. so yeah, that band looks great and it looks like it'd be a fun time but i don't think i'll be going because i have no plans for the 4th and i don't think i'll be able to get anyone to come. >:-(

went shopping today with michelle. had a good time, and was hella proud of myself for not buying anything. after i dropped her off i did purchase one thing: i went to linens and things and got these ice cube tray bottle things. you don't spill when you take them from the sink to the freezer, and once the things are frozen it doesn't matter what why you stick them in the freezer. this is a bonus for me as my freezer is always packed and i have no convenient shelf to stick the ice cube trays. i found blinds on my porch. since i've moved in here, i haven't been able to look at my porch without being dissatisfied. there were pull down shades on the windows, but that looked just so hella ghetto to me. i wanted matchstick blinds for it, because you could leave them pulled down and get privacy but they'd let the breeze through. matchstick blinds, while relatively cheap are too hella expensive for this ghetto girl. so i never purchased them. well, this evening i wanted to sit out on my porch and read (starting the harry potter series all over again) and i was irritated that i wasn't getting a cross breeze from the front of the building. i used to have a screen in the window that faced the front of the building, but it fell out one day and i stuck it in the storage closet on my porch because the little cat was clawing at it. i went to retrieve the screen from the closet today and i noticed that something else was in that closet as well: blinds. i dug out a few sets that were all wrapped up on each other and discovered that they were those cheap paper (felt?) blinds that filter in light. on each end of the top of the blind was a hole i looked up at the windows on my porch and there were nails on each side underneath where the pull down shades hung. so i hung up the blinds. they're hella dirty, so i'm going to have to figure out how you clean them, but i like them much better than the pull down shades. now what i need for my porch is some sort of shade for the bulb on the ceiling and i'd love a little bistro set (even if it was one of those plastic ones) because dining on my porch would just be too cool. i should probably get some plants as well. i have a big old hook out there for a hanging plant. i should get one. but really, there's probably no point to me getting a plant because i'll probably just kill it... so anyway... the blinds still look kind of ghetto to me compared to my vision of matchstick blinds, but hey, they're free. i think i have a porch inferiorty complex because the woman right behind me has such a pretty porch. she has a topiary on the windowsill (that looks just so... nice. not frilly/frumpy) and she's got a scarf draped across the top of all of the porch windows. her porch doesn't look right out onto someone's deck, so she doesn't need the privacy that i do, but i can't help but be all jealous of her nice porch. i have to keep reminding myself that she's in her thirties and has been living on her own much longer than i have and that's why her apartment is so grown up and pretty looking. my apartment will someday be grown up and pretty looking as well.... hopefully...

so the bonus about having a beetle is watching little kids punch each other wherever you go. on the way back from lunch today i was behind this old van from ohio that had like 4 kids in the back and when we stopped at a light one of the kids looked behind him, saw my car, and immediately punched the kid sitting next to him. then they were all wailing on each other. it was great... :)

yay! i got it to work! yay! i added a drop down menu to access my archives. i like this a lot. see it? it's over there -> on the right side under the links drop down menu. very cool. i got the code using a script generator on urlLink this site last night, but for some reason i couldn't get it to show up. yeah. it's because i needed to insert a break. that's it. hours of frustration last night and today i realized that it was there the whole time, hiding under a table. right. anyway, it works now, so yay! i've added a few more pages to the urlLink photo album . and i'm planning on adding my webcam in a popup window. but not tonight. tonight i go to bed early. it's been an alone time night. i was not expecting it to be one, but it turned out ok. i don't know why i was surprised that plans fell through. my horoscope today said that tonight would be an alone night. i watched Secretary which was one of the oddest movies i've ever seen. then i returned the dvds to hollywood video (on time for a change) and drove around albany. tonight is thursday night and there was a live at five concert tonight so there were lots of people out. i drove by urlLink mcgeary's and heard urlLink the burners uk playing while i was stopped at a red light. the part of the song that i heard was a heavy brass part, and it really made me want to go in and watch them. i truly do love a band with a nice loud brass section and a lot of energy. ...speaking of urlLink mcgeary's ... it is one week until my birthday and i just wanted to post a friendly reminder that i will be celebrating at mcgeary's that night watching urlLink HOTD and if you are my friend i expect you to be there... :)

this morning i saw two out of the ordinary things on the road. i thought this meant that today was going to be weird for me. thus far, that has not proved to be true, unless you count the fact that i've been pretty productive today so far as being odd. i guess it is actually pretty weird that i've been productive. oh! and it's really weird that i was the first person here in my department despite having gotten up late and missing my exit on the northway because i was too distracted by the out of the ordinary things i'd witnessed. anyway. so weird day. so the first out of the ordinary thing that i saw today (God, people should just ph34r my 1337 writing ski11z) was an SUV flying through the air flipping over. it was actually pretty scary. i was on I-90 West bound in the left lane preparing to shoot over across the middle lane and the right lane to exit onto the Northway when a few carlengths up from me in the left lane of the East bound side a white SUV (I dunno, possibly a Jeep or a Ford) suddenly struck the stone barrier between the two sides with his driver's side front corner. He was going at such a speed that he launched up the barrier and flew into the air while flipping over and then landed in the left lane causing the cars behind him to smash into him. it was so freaking scary. the sound of the metal scraping against the concrete was horrible. i wanted to cry. i picked up my cellphone and dialed 911 to report it. first time i've ever called 911. then i felt bad because here this person might have died and i saw it and the only thing i could do was report the accident and then go to work. but seeing that accident occur was pretty surreal. it looked like a scene from a movie. specifically, i immediately thought of the previews for Bad Boys II . really freaked me out, and i didn't speed (as much) the rest of the way to work. so then i was on the northway, still on my way to work, when i saw the second out of the ordinary thing today. i was in the middle lane (for a change), doing about 80 or so, when suddenly there was this loud noise next to me in the left lane. i looked to my left to see a motorcycle flying by me on one wheel. who does that?! i mean, this guy was on the Norway, doing at least 90 mph on a motorcycle, isn't that dangerous enough for him? why did he feel the need to do a wheelie as he flew by me? i guess on any other day i wouldn't have been as freaked out about that as i was, but having just witnessed a horrible accident i thought this guy was really taking an unnecessary risk. i almost rolled down my window to yell at him to be careful. anyway. so yeah. weird day. i hope no one died in that accident this morning.

so alex and i tried to go see pirates of the caribbean last night. the listing on urlLink timesunion.com said that there was a 10:30 show. we showed up at 10:30, but there was no show. annoying. and i was all excited to see orlando bloom ;) we ended up going to Denny's where we saw some heinous looking cars in the parking lot. one was a large metallic kermit the frog green boat of a car from the 70s and parked right next to it was a blue car (a honda, i think) that had a carbon fiber hood put on it and a huge spoiler on the back along with many other aftermarket parts. i thought it just looked stupid. we went back to my apartment afterwards and just bummed around and watched TV, which was very cool. :) i'm glad that bumming around and watching TV is enjoyable, because it's just about all i can afford to do nowadays. but i ask you: why is it that cats never need to use the litter box until there are people sitting in the room where the litter box is located? my cats were grossing me out so bad last night. i'm moving their litter boxes out to the porch tonight. it's been so nice lately that i've been leaving the kitchen door open so that the cats can go out onto the porch during the day anyway, so i might as well put the litter boxes out there for the summer. if only i could put a cat door on the kitchen door... then i could leave them out there year round.

i want to go see pirates of the caribbean like you wouldn't believe. most of the reviews for it are pretty good. the "tomatometer" at urlLink rotten tomatoes gives it an 85% fresh rating. and that's pretty good for a movie at that site. need to see it.

ugh. i fucking got sick again yesterday. my eyes were killing me. my left eye was worse than my right, but they were both red and really, really sensitive to light. suck. my sinuses were all stuffed also and i could barely open my left eye. i drove to work in the morning, but drove off the road at one point because i couldn't see. my eyes hurt so bad and they were watering and out of focus. suck. so i got to work and it wasn't too bad in the office, except for when light was reflecting off of my computer screen or papers or something. i made a dr appointment pretty much right away and had to call my mom to come drive me there because i couldn't drive. my dr (well, the NP, but close enough) rx'd me some antibiotics and told me to lie down with cold compresses on my eyes and to call her tomorrow (today) if the eyes weren't getting any better. it's not pink eye. actually, it hurts worse than pink eye. but it's good that i don't have that nasty infectious disease (again). i ended up going to my parents' house afterwards to lay down for the afternoon. i slept for 3 hours that afternoon. i know that i'm sick when i sleep. and i slept. the night before when the eye started hurting i slept for 2 hours after work and then went to bed early. and then yesterday i slept in the afternoon and went to bed by 10. ugh. i normally sleep at the most 8 hours a night and that's it. anyway. i'm feeling much better today. my eyes still aren't all the way back to normal yet but they're much better than they were yesterday. i hate being sick. i've been sick so much in the past six months or so. much more than i usually am. i hope i'm back to normal by my birthday....
been working on the blog... i've updated my urlLink photo album and adjusted the main page and the archives... more site updates to come soon, including the reappearance of the web cam.

three day weekends rule. every weekend should be a three day weekend. it was so nice to just spend days relaxing and then still have time to do fun things. friday i started my 4th of july by cleaning. i cleaned from 9:30am until 1pm. my apartment is so clean, it rules! i hope i can keep it that way... after my cleaning marathon i showered and headed up to my parents' house where i veg-ed out for a bit and then ate steak (rock!). mom made this brocolli salad that was hella good. the parents and the boys went to the fireworks in clifton park. i went with Carrie and John and Amy and Mike and Beth and Matt to the fireworks in Albany. they rocked . the finale was so freaking awesome. one firework after another after another... so cool. the theme of the show sucked though. i mean, who comes up with this crap? it was "peace love and something." i don't remember what the something was. but yeah. i mean, it was such a hippy love in show. they should have just handed out the pot. but the song selection didn't always fit the hippy theme, one of the songs was "ain't no mountain high enough" which reminded us of bridget jonse's diary so afterwards we went back to Carrie's apartment (where there's central air) to watch that movie. saturday was a quiet day for the most part. i got up and exercised for about an hour (rock!) then took a long bath and had a "spa day." Alex called around 7 and I met him and Steve at the marina in clifton park. they were borrowing shawn brimhall's boat. we went on a short ride on the mohawk. it was such a nice, relaxing ride. the temperature was perfect: warm, but when we were "speeding" along the breeze felt great. we watched some fireworks that people were setting off along the river, but it was ass buggy so we cut the ride short. sunday was also a quiet day. i spent most of the day watching tv and napping. wow, i lead a hard life. yeah. i went up to the parents' house for a while and to the country drive in with my sister and two of my little brothers. the little guy got ice cream all over him. we made him fold his hands and not touch anything in my car on the way home... later on i saw t3 with alex. i enjoyed the movie. it was loud and fun. and that's all i wanted it to be. there were some funny scenes... but overall just a lot of explosions and fight scenes. i was way into it for some reason, i kept getting all nervous for the characters and jumping when there were suspensful parts. so yeah. three day weekends rule. the only suckass thing about them is you get used to being lazy and getting back to work is more difficult than normal on a monday...

so more birthday crap. because i can't concentrate on work... i found out that there is such a thing as a star ruby. i've heard of star sapphires. i think they're gorgeous. i love sapphires in general, and star sapphires are just beautiful. i've always been disappointed that my birth stone is a ruby and not a sapphire. but now i found out that there are star rubies as well. i've never seen one. but now i need one. a pinkish one. because i love pink. urlLink here's a page on star sapphires and rubies.

so i went to look for my birthday horoscope online. i used to always look at the birthday horoscope in the times union. it felt so special to read it on your birthday because there's only one day a year that you can read the birthday horoscope and have it apply to you. i don't get the times union now that i don't live at home and they didn't have their horoscopes urlLink on their site (or at least they weren't easily found). so i did a google search for "horoscope birthday" and i found the urlLink New York Post horoscope for my birthday. Here it is: Your Horoscope for July 17, 2003 IF THURSDAY, JULY 17TH IS YOUR BIRTHDAY You will be incredibly impulsive this year: You will come and go at the drop of a hat and you will change direction, both in your personal life and in your career, without hesitation. Travel of all kinds is especially well starred, and the further away your adventures take you, the more you will get out of them. You may decide not to come back. so how exciting is that? i have become incredibly impulsive in the last year, so i can definitely see that first part applying to me. and i am travelling to Ireland in August, which is the furthest i've ever travelled. how exciting! what if i never come back? that would certainly be a change in my personal life and career... so now i'm all excited for my 24th year.

they say it's my birthday so that's cool :) i'm 24. definitely mid-twenties. that sucks. i'm not a kid anymore. that must make my parents feel old. Dodi came over last night and we made cookies. I wanted to make myself a birthday cake but apparently that's a pathetic thing to do and Meredith had told me not to do that when I mentioned it at work earlier. my coworkers decorated my cubicle for me today. rock. everyone should know it's my birthday and do nice things for me ;) i'm very excited to go out tonight and see hair of the dog. it's hard to concentrate here at work. people should be excused from working on their birthday.

so just in case anyone forgot: tomorrow is my birthday! yay! i'll be an old lady... 24 :( but i'll be going to urlLink mcgeary's tomorrow to celebrate my birthday and see urlLink hair of the dog , which rules! and remember, if you are my friend, you should come. and if you do not come you will make me pouty. and it's hella mean to make someone pouty on their birthday. i think i'm going to bake myself a cake tonight.

sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeet emoooooooooooooooooooooooootion. i'm listening to that song here at work. rock. so this weekend was pretty good. saw Pirates of the Caribbean on friday night. i loved that movie. first of all, Johnny Depp and Orlando Bloom are extremely hot. and Johnny Depp was very entertaining as the flamboyant and crazy Captain Jack Sparrow. and there were these little references in the movie to the ride at Disney World it was based on. like, there was a scene where prisoners were trying to tempt a dog that was holding the keys to the cell in his mouth with a bone. so right out of the ride. very cool. anyway, i'm going to have to own that movie when it comes out on DVD. Saturday I went to Sam's Club with my parents. they bought me shampoo and conditioner and contact solution. which rocks. i could have used some food as well, but when they asked me if i needed anything i felt very odd about asking for anything and they really had to keep at me to get me to ask for the shampoo and the contact stuff. getting those for me really helps though, because they're expensive items to buy. Later on I went with Beck to see Chicago (the movie) at Proctor's Theater. We were supposed to meet Carrie and John and Jen Peters, but we got there late and the movie had already started so we just found seats. It was awesome seeing a movie at Proctors. It felt like you were seeing a real show. And because it was a musical i wanted to clap after every number. And to top it all off, it was cheap: $2 to sit orchestra level and $3 for the balcony. Afterwards we met with Carrie, John, and Jen and went to Uno's for dessert/drinks. I needed the peanut butter cup dessert they have there. it is so good. Sunday I went to lunch with the lunch crew at Macaroni Grill. It was my birthday lunch and they brought me gifts and bought my lunch. rock! i made my own pasta dish (an option there) and it was fabulous: penne pasta with asiago cheese sauce and roasted garlic cloves, artichoke hearts and mushrooms topped with grilled shrimp. so good. Carrie and Amy gave me a gift certificate to Victoria's Secret and these awesome martini glasses that they have at Uno's (and that i was just admiring the night before) that have cobalt blue stems that twist. Joanne and John gave me a $50 gift cerficate to Bath and Body Works which I promptly speant that afternoon. it was so cool. Beck and I went to the mall right afterwards and the girls at Bath and Body Works said they had coupons there that they couldn't use: for $50 off of $100. so i got $100 worth of stuff and all i had to pay was $6 for tax. so cool. i got the complete line of a new "flavor" that smells like gin and tonics (well, it's coconut line verbena). it's awesome. and i got a bunch of candles and i got my mom's birthday gift (her birthday is today). rock. it was the coolest thing ever. later on I went with Alex to see The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen . it was not so good. very disappointing. suck. it was cool to hear Sean Connery say "That was naughty" but you can hear that on the previews so save your money.

ugh. long day. i really wanted to write a nice long post about the weekend, but then i got home this evening and paid all of my second-half-of-the-month-bills and now i'm poor and depressed so i'm just going to bed. bills suck .

so i've been playing with my new toy tonight (the digital cable) and i started watching the urlLink discovery health channel. this channel is always on in the waiting room of my doctor's office. i thought it would be incredibly dull, but the program that i'm watching is very interesting. it's called urlLink berman & berman and it's a talk show about women's (sexual) health issues run by two sisters (one is a sex therapist and the other is a urologist). i really like the way that the sisters run their show. it's not very smooth or whatever, but they're very frank. when they talk about specific topics it does seem like they're doing more of a presentation than a talk show, but then they start discussing the facts they just presented and it's back to the talk show format again. their topic tonight is virginity. they had a "secondary virgin" on who talked about how she was into "drugs and rock and roll" when she was in her teens and twenties and that she dressed "like a hoochie-mama" (I can't believe she actually used that term, i was embarrassed for her) but that one day she felt an emptiness inside her so she went to church and decided to be celibate. ok. good for her. whatever. but then she started talking about how sex is dirty and that she wants to save herself for her wedding day and wear the white dress because she wants her husband to know that she waited her whole life for him blah blah blah and i'm thinking, well honey, you already blew that. i'm sorry, but deciding to not have sex until you're married after you've already had sex (and lots of it from what she was saying) does not make you a virgin. it makes you a wannabe. and it certainly does not mean that you can tell your husband you've waited your whole life for him. then they had this other woman on who was a 35 year old "true" virgin. she's in a relationship right now where they don't even kiss. she thinks they're heading towards marriage and expects to be married by the end of the year. she seemed pretty relaxed about the whole thing. she wasn't saying that sex was dirty or whatever. and she said that she's accepting and warm towards people who don't share her beliefs, that it's a personal choice. but when one of the sisters asked her what if her husband sucks she pretty much responded that she wouldn't know the difference and that he'd be able to teach her about sex (he's a "secondary" virgin) and they'd have the rest of their lives to get it right. uh huh. i feel bad for her. she's waited for 35 years. can you imagine that pressure on her wedding night? and she won't even masterbate because she feels that it's witholding something from her husband. wow. one of the audience members spoke up and said that she was 35 years old and a virgin on her wedding night and she claims that she is blessed and has a wonderful sex life. i don't really believe her. i mean, how would she really know? she said that one of the best things for her about waiting is that her husband feels very special because "he's the only one for [her]." right. the thing that's really disturbing to me about these women is that one of the major reasons they are virgins is to make their husbands feel special. whatever. that's really heinous to me. i mean, these women don't require that their husbands be virgins when they marry them. both 35 year olds were partnered with men who had already had sex (and the secondary virgin wasn't dating so i don't know whether she expected her husband to be and also she's desperate and hasn't dated since she's turned celibate and also she's a faker so i don't count her). what a freaking double standard that is! i mean, they want their men to feel special because they're the only guys they've been with, but they don't expect the same from their men? it seems to me that waiting until your wedding night is supporting a view of women that places them in a servientile role to their husbands. and that's incredibly offensive to me. i agree that most kids (let's not limit it to girls) have sex way before they are emotionally ready to handle it, but i don't think that means they should wait until they're married. i think they should wait until they're ready. of course, that leads to the question, "how do you know when you're ready?" and i don't really have an answer for that. i guess it's different for everyone. i was 18 when i first had sex and thinking back on it i was really such a stupid young kid. but i don't think it was too soon. i think i was ready. i was in college and with a guy that i was in love with at the time and that i wasn't doing it for him (to keep him with me or something like that), i was doing it for me. i guess that's how i knew i was ready. i think that when you have that experience of being that intimate with someone else it can mature you. so someone who never experiences that is lacking a maturity in that arena and doesn't seem to be fully an adult to me. how can you make adult decisions about the rest of your life (marriage) when you still have a childlike view on some things? people need to own their sexuality. it's not something to be ashamed of or something that should be saved or surrendered to another person. anyway. interesting show. love the digital cable.

digital cable rules. Episode II was on one of the many urlLink HBO channels and the picture was actually awesome. i didn't really expect the picture to look much different, but it really looked great. it looked like i was playing a DVD.
