So ew. Also, it'd be kind of really weird to have your dad come to a bar with you and your friends. I guess if he was divorced or something... I dunno. Anyway. It was a good night. :) Today we slept in late and then went out for lunch and picked up a new battery for Alex's car. He was stuck here all day Thursday because when he went to leave the battery was dead. When I got home from work I found him vacuuming the floors, dishes done, and no food left in the house. Not that there was much to begin with. I felt so bad! All I had here for him to eat was half a bag of "treasure crisps", two non-frosted strawberry poptarts, and some crackers. I'm glad I didn't go to the gym after work or anything and I came right home! We'd tried to jump his car that night but it just wasn't happening, so he had to borrow his dad's car Friday to get around in. But we got a new battery today and he installed it no problem and the car's working fine. So rock :) The unfortunate thing about his having to get a new battery is that it took the rest of his $ (after last night) and so he had no $ to go out tonight (we were going to go to either his CPHM Ambulance banquet or up to 'Toga). I'm tight on the cash as well, and we did go out last night, and he has to work a 24 hour shift anyways tomorrow, so it's no big deal. So Alex is home tonight and I'm here. I tried to call Dodi, but she's unavailable, so I'm spending the night in updating the site and then playing the sims. I have about a million chores I could do tonight (last night's dishes... change the sheets... swiffer the floors... clean the bathroom... take down the tree...) but I refuse to do chores on a Saturday night and instead I'm planning on taking the entire day tomorrow to get shit like that done. So yeah. Sims are calling... morelater...

RASH DESICION:: I've decided to move the blog! Please update your favorites/bookmarks/links (if you've graced me with a spot there) to: urlLink http://aliwolly.homeip.net/blog.html . So I'm constantly trying to find new cool (free) things to do with my phone so that I don't get bored with it and buy a new one. I mean, I desperately want a new phone. Mine doesn't even have a camera built in! ;) Dodi cured my need recently by giving me the old camera attachement to one of her old phones ( she has one of those really cool camera-built-in phones...). So now I can take pictures with the mini-camera and upload them to my phone and have people's pictures displayed when they're calling. But only on the inside . So I have to open up my phone to see the picture, and I have my phone set to answer when flipped open, so the picture's only there for a second. So then I'm back to lusting after one of those new camera phones because their external LCDs are color and can display people's pictures on the outside. Sigh... So I was playing online this weekend looking around for something new to add to my phone or some new way to use my phone so I wouldn't have such lackluster feelings about it for a while when I stumbled across urlLink pcsphonetones.com . This site has a lot of potential. It's a site that offers free ringers and backgrounds for SprintPCS Vision phones. ROCK! I downloaded the Indiana Jones theme song and "Everybody Hurts" by REM. The coolest thing I found on that site was this: Zelda (original Nintendo) backgrounds and ringers. Awesome!! So now my phone's background is the start screen to the original Zelda game (one of my all-time favorite games, ever ) and when I get a voicemail it plays the beginning of the theme song and when I get a text message it plays the tune that played when you got another piece of the triforce. I know, I'm a dork. But I think that rules!!! Anyway, I say the site has potential because there's not much there yet. But I'm hoping that they'll add a lot of cool stuff, so I plan on checking back often. In fact, I think it might make it over into my links drop down -> The other excellent thing that I found online this weekend to keep me from hating my phone is urlLink xingtones . This little app lets you convert any wav, midi, or mp3 into a polyphonic phone tone for your Sprint PCS Vision phone. It was really easy to use, and it's free as long as you give them 3 email referrals. And this is one program that I wouldn't mind getting a referral for. It's awesome! Or, it has the potential to be. It does exactly what I wanted it to do: converts your music file and then downloads it to your phone. The song clip can be a maximum of 30 seconds and the program has a very easy way to clip your songs. You have complete control over the length and position of the clip in the song. It is annoying that there isn't a running time when you play the song so that you can pinpoint exactly when you're trimming your clip. But they say they're constantly improving their product on the webpage, so perhaps in the future... The other dissappointing thing about it is the quality of the ringtones is not that great. I originally tried it with an mp3 - "Old Black Rum" by HOTD - and the quality was pretty shitty. But I was at the parents house and had nothing else to use (got that mp3 from the HOTD website) so when I got home I tried using a wav (because I figured that starting with a compressed mp3 and compressing it further was just no good). I ripped a wav of "All of the Hard Days Are Gone" off of my Let it Flow cd because I was intent on having a HOTD ringer. I had better results using the wav, but the quality was still crappy (see, we moved from shitty to crappy). So I figured that part of the problem was all the harmony and instruments, so I ripped a wav of "The Parting Glass" off of the At the Parting Glass cd and had much better results. Apparently accapella songs work best. The quality is still not that great, but it'll do. So then I did the same with "The Barley Mow" and now I have 2 decent HOTD ringers for my phone. Rock! I'm very excited about this app, and I hope they do improve the quality, because it'd be almost perfect but for the quality... :) So yeah. Exciting phone weekend. I got a bunch of new ringers and backgrounds and a cool new app so that I can make as many new free ringers as my little heart desires. I also got a new, great deal with Sprint. I wanted to add the nights and weekends starting at 7 option, but I couldn't do it online for some reason, and I wanted to decrease the minutes on my plan to make it cheaper, but my plan had vision services included and I didn't want to lose that and have to pay an extra $10 a month for it or whatever they make you pay now. So I went to the Sprint store Saturday with Dodi and they couldn't help me there, but they gave me the number to customer service and I called there and spoke with Greg. Greg was very nice (and maybe he only seemed so because of the southern accent) and very helpful and gave me everything I wanted. Rock! So my new plan is $30/month for 300 anytime minutes and an extra $5/month for nights and weekends starting at 7 and my vision is included and he didn't extend my agreement with them for another 2 years like they are supposed to make you do if you want the nights and weekends at 7 thing. Awesome! So i'm happy with Sprint again (for now) and I'm happy with my phone again (hopefully for a while).

I am just so sad to be back at work... I had a four day weekend because of the holiday on New Year's Day and then I took Friday off of work, so it was just so nice to do basically nothing for four days. Getting up this morning after sleeping in for four days straight was annoying. But not hell, because I tried this thing that my dad always said worked: when I was going to sleep last night, I kept telling myself that I was going to wake up in seven hours and that I'd be up by 6:35. And it worked! I totally never believed him when he said that he didn't need an alarm clock because he just told his body when he wanted to get up. I'm so psyched that it worked. I'm going to do that every night, because getting up at 6:35 makes the morning less hellish. I was totally (pretty much) on time to work today and I even had to start my car ahead of time and de-snow it. Awesome! So yeah. The extended weekend was good. New Year's Eve was fun. Beck, Kevin, Dodi, Tristan, Kevin's sister, Bergeron, and I went to the Macaroni Grill for dinner. Beck met me at my house beforehand and we had a couple of Vodkatini's (which turned out pretty good, considering I made them). Then Kevin picked us up and we met everyone at the Macaroni Grill where I had two Cosmopolitans. So I was pretty drunk by the time we were leaving to go to the Big House. I had another Cosmo at the Big House, but the one there sucked, it had sours mix or something in it. So the combination of the large amount of dinner and the bad drink that I had made me feel kind of sick. I hope I didn't bring the group down, but I was pretty "reserved" for the rest of the night. Kevin and Beck brought me home soon after the ball dropped, and I passed out pretty much immediately. New Year's Day was quiet. Alex had worked a very busy 24 hour shift on New Year's Eve, so he wasn't around, and Beck was spending a quiet day at home and Dodi wasn't available for most of the day. So I hung out at the parents' house for a good part of the day, and then hung out with Dodi that night. We watched Cruel Intentions and ate buttery microwave popcorn and mini hot dogs wrapped in cresent rolls. It was a fabulous impromptu girl's night. :) Friday I got up kind of late and cleaned up my room (which desperatly needed to be done). Then I went to the gym and brought shower stuff along so I could shower there afterwards and get right to my day. I've never showered at this gym before, and I found the shower facilities to be... adequate. They weren't as nice as those at the YMCA in Clifton Park, but they were better than most of the hostel showers in Europe... After the gym I went to the bank to deposit Christmas checks and then went shopping around for a liquor cabinet or other piece of furniture that I could repurpose as one. I was not lucky in my search. Ah well. Alex came over later that night and we went to dinner at Delmonico's. He had the Delmonico's Delmonico steak and I got some special that was steak tips in portobella sauce over garlic mashed potatoes. He let me have a bite of his steak and I instantly regretted not getting the steak. It was divine . My dinner was very good, but compared to the steak... ah well. Now I sound like my mom ;) Anyway, we came back to the apartment afterwards and watched Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom which is my favorite Indiana Jones movie. I was so into the movie and excited about watching it... and then I suddenly passed out. Ah well. But yeah, it was an excellent night. :) Saturday morning I got up and left Alex sleeping while I went to the mall and met Dodi and Beck to see Mona Lisa Smile . First we went to Ruby Tuesday's for lunch, where we got awful service (again). It's like they hire idiots there. The movie was pretty good. Actually, it was really good, up until the end when they just decided to wrap the movie up really quick and it was kind of disappointing. Whatever. The theater was packed , in fact, we couldn't get three seats together, so Dodi and I sat in the row above Beck. That was kind of annoying... Afterwards we walked around the mall for a bit, and Beck met up with Kevin. Dodi and I went back to her place where we ate Taco Bell (ghetto fabulous) and watched American Beauty . I'd never bothered to watch that movie before. I enjoyed it, but I didn't think it was as enormously amazing as everyone would have you believe. Dodi curled my hair while we watched the last hour of The Ring on HBO, and I was terrified... that I'd jump and knock my head into the curling iron and get burnt. We picked up her cousin, Jill, and then went to the Big House for drinks and dancing. I almost bailed on them, we didn't get to my apartment so I could change until almost 11 and I was tired, but they convinced me to go out with them and I'm glad I did. :) The drinks were strong Saturday night at the Big House... the bartenders were very free with their pouring of the Bombay Sapphire. But every time I drink Sapphire, my drunkness doesn't hit me right away, so I end up drinking a lot thinking it's not affecting me, and then suddenly I'm drunk. So thankfully I was pretty buzzed by the time we went to the third floor to go dancing, because usually I get a little self-concious about dancing, but I wasn't bothered by anything and had a great time. Dodi and Jill dropped me off at home around 2am, and being alone and drunk and a little hungry, I proceeded to pig out on junk food. I had potato chips, and then since I had something salty, I needed something sweet, so I broke out a bag of almond M&M's that Alex had bought the weekend before for our trip, but we never opened. I never buy almond M&M's so I wasn't immediately aware that the packaging is very boring and looks sort of like the new black and white packaging they have for the contest where if you find a bag of colored m&m's inside a black and white bag you win a convertible beetle and $20k and a trip. So yeah. So I opened the bag of almond M&M's thinking that they were in the new b&w packaging and when I saw colored M&M's on the inside, I was like, "woah... I WON!!!" And then I realized that there were all different colored M&M's inside the bag, and the winning bags have all just one color... and then I realized that I wasn't dreaming, and I never win contests, so I closely examined the exterior of the bag and came to the conclusion that I wasn't a winner and that the packaging for almond M&M's is boring. I mean, who associates the color, taupe, with almonds, anyway? So yeah. Sunday was another quiet day. I went to the parents house for the afternoon and hung out with the family. I met Beck at Starbuck's that evening before she returned to Poughkeepsie. I went home and watched the season premiere of Sex and the City (I'm so sad there are only 7 episodes left!!) and then I played Sims and went to bed at a reasonable hour (10:30). And now I'm back at work and that blows.
fixed the font... not in the mood to update now.

so... Tuesday evening I went straight to urlLink WW from work. I signed up and got in line for the middle scale. I don't know why, but I always went to the middle scale when I was weighing in last time I was losing weight. So yeah. The scale was less than what my scale at home would have said. I think I remember from last time that my scale at home was always consistently 3 lbs higher. So yeah. I've got about 24 lbs that I want to lose. I can do it, I'm sure. I mean, I lost 60 lbs last time. I'm oddly nervous about it though. Like, for some reason I'm worried that I'll do everything right and that for some reason it won't work. I'm crazy. Anyway, so Carrie's meeting was awesome :) She's so high energy, and she has good control over the group without it feeling like a lecture. And her members really seem to love her. So that rocks. Next week I start helping out before the 7:00 meeting as a greeter. I'm excited that Carrie was able to help me out and get me this "job" because otherwise I wouldn't be able to afford to go to the meetings. :) After the meeting (I stayed for the "getting started" session because the plan has changed since I did it last... I love the changes) I ran home and made a very quick PB&J (3 points) and stuffed it in my mouth as I ran out the door to get in Meredith's car to go to the urlLink LAOH meeting. It was a good time, though I'm not allowed to reveal any of the goings on ;) Afterwards Meredith and I went to The Fountain (a pub right near my house) so that I could get some dinner: Guinness (3) and French Onion Soup (6). And I even stayed within my points that day! Wednesday I went to the gym after work and busted my ass on the treadmill and elliptical machine. I went home and talked to Dodi on the phone for a bit, and then talked to Alex who was able to get OT at work, but therefore was unable to come over. :( Ah well. I was stinky/sweaty from the gym anyway and not in the mood to take a shower and I also had plenty of chores to do. So I got to the chores: I un-decorated the tree and then disassembled it. I had to throw out the tree skirt (2nd one this season!!!) because Molly and Dude had decided that it was an indoor litter box and, well, ew. I mopped the floor underneath and trashed the skirt. I brought the tub on wheels from the porch that I bought at Wal-Mart and had to clean off that as well, because for some reason Molly peed on it. EW!! My cats are disgusting. So after cleaning off the frozen pee (and wanting to vomit) I filled the tub with my Christmas. I de-Christmased the entire apartment and was able to fit it all in the tub on wheels. I even stuck my Christmas wrapping paper stuff in there as well, so all of Christmas is in one place. Rock! After de-Christmasing the apartment, I cleaned out the kitty litter box that has a handle on top of it and I placed it right outside of my kitchen door. I now put it inside th eapartment when I leave, and when I'm home I stick it out on the porch (and I bring it in overnight). So now I don't have to worry about having a potentially smelly box inside the house or having the cats just go somewhere because they have no access. After I was done with that, I was exhausted and went to bed... Thursday I went directly home after work! Yay! First time this week! I did my dishes and devoured a Nutri-Grain bar (3). I was planning on cooking dinner: WW Chinese Orange Chicken (5), white rice (4), and string beans (0). I didn't. Alex came over directly from work and we were going to go see Big Fish but we decided not too (too cold outside, too late at night), so we stayed in an ordered Chinese food instead (had a coupon... and it was too late to start cooking). We ate our Chinese food and drank red wine and both passed out on the sofa before 11. We're such gomers ;) So yeah. The week's been good. Busy, but good. I've been able to stay within my points, and I've been making it to the gym. We'll see how this goes... I'm so glad it's Friday and I don't have to be at work for 2 days. That rules. Work is oddly quiet today. Not the phones, but the people. We're all just sitting here, quietly doing our work (or posting to our blogs... damn!). It sounds like a Saturday. I hope the afternoon goes quick... I can't wait to get out of here!

I don't think I'll ever know how many licks it takes to get to the tootsie roll center of a tootsie pop. I always lose count. And then just bite the fucker. So Saturday night I was up until about 4am playing with the site and organizing pictures on my hard drive. I guess that's what boredom will do to you :) Sunday was quiet... went home and did laundry... met dodi for dinner & then watched SATC at her apt... came home and went to bed. (note: did none of the chores other than the laundry that I'd planned on doing). Today: went to work. Uneventful day. Carrie thinks she'll be able to get me a job as a greeter at her 5:30 urlLink weight watcher meetings, so that would give me a very nice discount and be absolutely fabulous. I'd not joined yet, even though I'm dying to lose some weight again and need some help, because I'm so asspoor. Ugh. But at least Carrie helped me figure out fitting WW into my "budget." Now I just have to stress about paying my monthly urlLink gym dues of $32. How ghetto is that, that I'm worried about spending an extra $32/month? Sigh. So no huge updates. I meant to, but then I went to the gym and came home and watched Teen Witch on HBO (what a cheesey movie) and now I'm just done . I'm totally ready to pass out. I think I'm going to make myself do the dishes at least. I'm totally embarrassed that my tree is still up and that the cat litter is still dirty, but I guess I have to own it and just do a little at a time. I was thinking that I'd get shit done tomorrow night and that I'd be all good and cook dinner, but after the WW meeting I've got the LAOH meeting at 7:30, and I've got no idea when I'll be getting home. Hopefully not too late! (Probably not, because the ladies at that meeting are all old... that was kind of mean, but kind of true.) So yeah. Starting WW tomorrow (well, actually started it today, but going to meetings starting tomorrow). Found a site on women and weight lifting that is very interesting. The woman who writes it is pretty funny too. This is what she writes about the dietary supplement, Fat Trapper: "Sure, it traps the fat, and where do you think all that clumped fat goes if you don't digest it? Buy yourself some adult diapers with every bottle of Fat Trapper, and stock up on fat-soluble vitamins to replace what gets leached out of your body. Unless you think anal leakage is sexy, don't bother. Same with Olestra. Remember, we digest our food for a reason! Throw Fat Trapper and Olestra into the toilet (for a realistic effect, shoot it out of a shotgun from across the room to simulate the explosive colonic action you'd experience from eating it), and eliminate the middle man." I was pretty hysterical after I read that. A lot of her other articles are just as entertaining, and I think urlLink her site is definitely worth a look . Well, now that I feel like I've written a completely unintelligent, wandering post... It's time to do the dishes. :(
I finally finished the captions for the photos for London, Dublin and Edinburgh!! Check them out at the urlLink photo album .

Orange Chicken With a Side of Burnt Plastic I got home from the gym and I was exhausted. It was about 6:45 Wednesday night and I was ready for bed. But I had to eat something and since I was home alone, I was planning on making a quick burrito: low fat tortilla with fat free refried beans and fat free chedder cheese wrapped inside and microwaved for about a minute. I'd just plopped my gym bag down in the middle of the floor and threw my coat over a chair and was rummaging through my "junk" drawer (they're all junk drawers with my organizational skills...) when I heard keys jingling outside of the front door to my apartment. I stopped and looked around to see Alex walking in the door. "Crap," I thought, "I'm all freaking smelly from the gym... and this place is a dump!" But I said, "Hey!" and walked over to give him a hug. "I smell," I said. "I know," he said. I punched him in the arm and he hugged me again. "Have you eaten yet?" "No, I just got home from the gym... Do you want me to make something?" He looked shocked and horrified at the possibility. I went on: "I've got chicken in the fridge that I took out of the freezer last Thursday to make, but I haven't used it yet and I better use it before it goes bad..." and I set about moving things around in the fridge trying to get to the chicken which had settled in the back on the bottom shelf. I took out the chicken and set it on the counter and looked at it for a minute trying to assess if it was bad. Alex picked up the package and squinted at the date: "November 20th," he read and looked at me like I was trying to poison him. "I bought it then and it's been frozen since then... I just took it out of the freezer the other day," I explained. He didn't look convinced, but he put the package down. I sliced through the plastic and sniffed at the chicken. It didn't smell bad, so I figured it must be good. I put the now opened package back down on the counter and turned to look at the recipe I'd pulled up on my computer screen when Alex rushed by me and snatched the chicken up from the counter and stuck it on the stove. "salmonella! You shouldn't put meat on the counter!" He flew into the bathroom to grab the Clorox Wipes and began wiping down the counter and when he was finished he scrubbed his hands. Meanwhile I oiled the pan and seasoned the chicken. I think watching me cook was a stressful event for Alex. I kept dripping chicken juice and dropping things. He'd follow behind me and clean the "salmonella" off of whatever I'd dripped on. I have to admit, that I was very disorganized in my cooking attempt. I started the rice a little late and then forgot when I'd started it so I had no idea when to take it out (had to wing it... turned out fine). Then I misread the label on the can of mandarin oranges and accidentally opened two cans to make the orange chicken sauce and had to scoop half of the oranges into a container mid-sauce-making. I turned the chicken too late and ended up burning parts of it. And the string beans which I'd planned on making with the chicken had gone bad (though I didn't realize it right away and Alex, horrified, pointed out that there was mold on some of the beans). Dinner was almost done when Alex came over to inspect... and picked up one of my new knives that I got for Christmas that I'd left on the stove apparently too close to one of the burners. "I knew I smelled something burning other than chicken!" he said as he held up the knife by the blade to show me that the black plastic handle had begun to melt. "Oh no!! That was one of my new knives!" I screetched. Alex quickly grabbed another knife and pushed the melting plastic pretty much back into shape: "See, good as new." He hugged me and told me I was cute when I was upset. Which made me feel better... ...until I walked into the living room with our plates of food and saw that there was smoke filling my apartment. "It's kind of hazy in here," Alex said as he opened one of the windows and stuck the fan in it. "Yeah..." I said as I sank down onto the sofa. "Why can't I do this! Why do I suck at cooking!" I whined. "Aw, you don't suck!" he said. And he put on a good show of eating the chicken. And I guess it wasn't actually too bad... if you could get past the smell of burnt plastic that lingered in the air. So it was yet again another adventure in cooking for me. They say that practice makes perfect, but I'm afraid that one of these times I'm going to burn the place down...
So I weighed in last night for the first time since I started WW last week, and I lost 3.2 lbs! Rock! :)

There's a spider above the kitchen cabinets. I'm terrified that he'll fall on me. I've tried to kill it, but I'm afraid I'll miss and he'll fall on me. ugh. Why can't I get over my fear of spiders? ew ew ew ew ew ew ew.

so i've been watching oxygen tonight. i got sucked in by this episode of "the knot: real weddings" (or something like that) with this sort of psycho bride. she was very cheerleader. like, i really believe she was a cheerleader in high school/college. she was very controlling at her rehearsal... she had this voiceover going where she was saying something like, "i really want to relax and not worry about everything because in a few weeks people won't remember the dinner, all they'll remember is if they had a good time or not." but while the voiceover was going she was on screen screaming at people to get in line and rolling her eyes at her family members and just being pretty much a psycho. then on the big day she drove herself to her wedding (which was sort of depressing to me) and she was in the car alone with the camera guy and she was drinking a glass of wine as she was driving. and they showed her drinking at home before she left. and it was pretty apparent that she was buzzed trying to drive this car. i was shocked. yeah. but it was a beautiful wedding... ;) yeah. and now i'm watching the ellen degeneres show. she's freaking hysterical. :) I need to go to bed though... sleepy...

Then I saw these hot pink cupcakes and decided that we must get them. So we got some blue ones too (because he's a boy). But I just had to share my joy that is the hot pink cupcake: (today is fun with my camera for my phone day, can you tell?)

I walked out to my car after lunch and was greeted with this: I had ghetto writing on my car. It totally must've happened last night while it was parked on the street outside of my apartment... and I live in a nice neighborhood! GhettoBeetle. I'm so kind of embarrassed that I drove to work like that! Like I was advertising whatever the ghetto writing says... I totally have to wash the car after the gym tonight. It's a good thing my sister paid me back partially in quarters... now I won't have to get change before I wash the car! :) I'm so kind of skeeved that someone touched my car though...

Friday night I got home from the gym to find Alex waiting for me. I showered and he made me pick where to go for dinner. When I couldn't come up with anything, he suggested that we go to El Loco Mexican Cafe on Madison Ave. I had, like, a billion points left for the day and was totally in the mood for Mexican food so that's where we went. We got to El Loco Mexican and it was packed . The cafe is very small, with four-seater booths along one wall, two seater rectangular tables in the middle that can be pushed together for larger parties, and two seater small circular tables along the other wall. There's a bar in the back right corner that is just basically an opening in the wall to the kitchen area with no seats in front of it. The hostess suggested that we stand by the bar and said that it should only be a few minutes. We stood at the bar and ordered our drinks (I had a sangria - which was very good - and Alex had a Corona). Then two women walked in and also stood by the bar, and we were annoyed to see them seated before us. The hostess bitchily explained that the two women had another person in their party that was parking the car and they were seated at a table to handle three and we needed to wait for a two seater table. What was annoying was there were at least two 2 seater tables that were already open but not cleaned and at least 3 other four seaters. Annoying. Whatever. We got seated a few minutes later and ordered chips with two types of salsa for dipping. The salsa there was awesome ! We tried to figure out what to order but the menu was so big and there was a couple behind Alex that was very distracting, so it took us a bit... The couple behind Alex was apparently going through a divorce. Alex gave me the play-by-play as they fought. And then he didn't have to because they got loud . How embarrassing! They finally left... they got very quiet before they left and then they hurried out of there. I wonder who paid for dinner? Anyway. By the time they left we'd been served our dinners. I got a spinach burrito and Alex got the burrito grande. The food was fabulous! I'd definitely go back (even though the service was a little sucky). After dinner we went to Crossgates to see Big Fish . The theater was packed and we ended up sitting in the very front section on the floor where the seats tilt back so that you can see the screen. The leaning of the seats made it easy to lean on Alex at the same time, so I was able to watch the movie pretty comfortably. The move was great. I really enjoyed it and so did Alex. The ending was kind of sad and I totally cried. But yeah, the movie was very enjoyable and I'm glad we went to see it. Saturday night I went to HOTD at Revolution Hall with Beck and Dodi. I'm ass, ass poor, so the girls had to convince me to come out with them and that it was ok that they paid for me because that's what friends do. As of Friday I was down to $100 until I get paid again (2 weeks), because I had to renew my gym membership and I was charged fees that I wasn't expecting. So blow. But yeah, the girls wanted me to come out with them and so I went (even though I felt like a ghetto-poor tool). I remembered that my sister owed me $13, so after I talked to her and she told me she'd give me the $13 on Sunday, I let myself go to the bank and get out $20. So after Beck paid my way in, I used my $20 to buy us the first round of Guinness. We got the last table on the lower level which was right up front and center. It so rocked that we got a table, and we could totally pull off sitting right front and center because we're all so familiar with the band. We had an awesome time. Kevin and his friends showed up after a little bit and they seemed to enjoy the band as well. Dodi was totally flirting with the big guy in HOTD (he told her she was beautiful at the last show) so I told her to ask him to sing "The Parting Glass" at the end and he totally did (which rocked because I love that song and I haven't heard him sing it in forever because lately he doesn't sing it unless they're at the Parting Glass. So yeah. I had an awesome time (but I totally missed Alex because HOTD always reminds me of him and he couldn't come out because he had to be at work at 7 the next morning for a 24 hr shift). After HOTD I went home and Beck and Dodi headed up to CP. Beck, unfortunately, got harrassed all night. The rebound guy from last year kept drunk dialing her. She didn't want to talk to him, he should have just gotten the picture and stopped calling. How embarassing for him. Today was quiet. I woke up at 8 when Alex came walking into my bedroom and scared the crap out of me :) He needed to drop by and grab his work shirt, which he left here Thursday night. He gave me a quick hug and a kiss and went back to work. I layed there and could only think, "God, how bad must I look?!" I checked myself out in the mirror in the bathroom and determined that I didn't look too bad. Then I read for about an hour but then decided that sleep ruled and went back to sleep until 11. I got up and pretty much sat around the house until about 3 when I finally got my act together and went grocery shopping. So now I have food (hopefully enough for 2 weeks) and about $50 left. Sigh. I'm sure I'll survive though ;) My sister came by for a little bit and dropped of the $13 but she soon left to go hang out with one of her friends. That was ok, because Beck had called and was about to head back to Poughkeepsie and wanted to meet for coffee. So we met at the Starbuck's in Stuyvesant Plaza. I had a tall black coffee, and I think my buzz is just wearing off now... :) I came home to watch SATC and I've been watching TV all night. I rule. It was a nice, relaxing day. I'd totally forgotten until a few minutes ago that our new "flex hours" start at work tomorrow, and I don't have to be there until 8:30, so that rocks!! So it's ok that it's 11 and I'm still up, because I don't have to get up until like 7/715 and I'll totally get 8 hours of sleep if I go to sleep now. Rock! So yeah. Boring post, sorry. I'll try and come up with some interesting stuff this week instead of just recaps of my days...

So part of my job is to review medical bills as they come in for a claim with an injury in it to make sure that the treatment the injured person is getting is related to the accident and that it's reasonable. The medical portion of auto insurance is where the most fraud is, so reviewing the medical claims is a large part of my job and it's the part of my job that I find particularly interesting and enjoyable. I really enjoy reading the notes for a hospital or doctor visit and decoding the medical jargon. Last week I came across a term that I'd never heard before. I was reading notes for a claim in which the injured person was claiming injury to her right wrist. She's, of course, from Gloversville and the doctor that she was treating with was also from Gloversville. I get the "best" notes out of Gloversville. The grammar alone in the notes is enough to make a person want to run away screaming from any doctor or hospital out in that area. This particular note was detailing the pain the injured person was experiencing in her right arm and it said that she was "complaining of pain and tenderness along the radial styloid and anatomical snuffbox." This line stopped my in my tracks. "Anatomical snuffbox?" I wondered... "What's that?!" I mean, that sounds nasty... So I went over to my supervisor's bookshelf and pulled The Anatomy Coloring Book off the shelf to consult. (I love that book, by the way... I totally want one for myself so I can color the whole thing in!) I flipped through until I found the page dealing with the wrist/hand area. I found the radial styloid right away - that's the part at the base of the thumb. But I didn't see any listing for "anatomical snuffbox". So I asked Mary Ellen. She immediately thought the worst and we were both giggling as she dialed up a friend who's a nurse to see if she knew what it was. She prefaced her question with, "Now, get your mind out of the gutter..." and after she asked the question I could hear giggling on the other end of the line as well. Mary Ellen's friend asked around in her office and was informed that the anatomical snuffbox is the fleshy part of your hand between your thumb and your forefinger... kind of like the "crotch" of your hand... Ok, that's nasty too ;) I guess it's called an anatomical snuffbox because back in "the day" people used to put tobacco (or as Mary Ellen explained it, cocaine) there to snuff it through their nose. So I guess you learn something new every day... :)

I can remember playing at being a teacher when I was little, and if anyone would ask me what I wanted to be when I grew up, I'd tell them I wanted to be a teacher, but I think that was because I lacked imagination. Well, no, I was a pretty imaginative kid, so it wasn't a lack of imagination, it was just the easy way out. I mean, besides my parents, teachers were the only adults I knew, so I picked the teaching profession because I didn't know what all was out there to choose from. And I guess I still don't really know all that's out there for a person to do in this world. I just ended up in the job I'm in now... I knew I needed a full time job and I knew I wanted one that required a degree because I'd earned that, and this one fit the bill. It was the only job I interviewed for when I first started looking, and when they offered me the job, I accepted it because it was the easiest option. I've been lazy, and it was starting to show. At work my desk began to pile up with mail, and my diary count of items I needed to address in individual files soared. I didn't know what to do about it; I was overwhelmed and didn't know how to dig myself out of my mess. I didn't care, either. I don't care about automobile insurance and I couldn't figure out how to make myself care about my job. Outside of work my laziness was showing as well. I'd gained a few pounds (even went out and bought jeans in the next size up), I'd done nothing to improve my financial situation, and my apartment became a disgusting black hole of filth. Then, a couple of weeks ago, two things occurred that helped me change my attitude. First, Carrie offered me the member helper position at her WW meetings, allowing me to be able to afford to attend meetings again. I've never been successful at losing weight without attending WW meetings, and once I started back at the meetings I instantly switched modes back to being serious about losing weight. Then, I had a review with my supervisor in which she pretty much told me, in a very nice way, that I've been a slacker and that I needed to start catching up. She said she'd help me get through it because she understood how I got there, but if I didn't turn my performance around she wouldn't be so understanding in the future. She gave me a few ideas on how to handle a workload that seemed completely overwhelming and turn it into something manageable. Her plan made sense, and something finally clicked in my head that allowed me to see past my total lack of interest I have in insurance to what was important about my job: that I put in an effort that I can be proud of. Since then I've been busting my ass at work trying to do the very best job I can. It's been hard owning up to my mistakes, but I know I just have to own it so that I can move past it and do a better job in the future. I definitely don't plan on being at my current job forever, but while I'm here I want to do work that I can be proud of. That, at least, makes the job bearable. My new work ethic, combined with my new vigilance towards my weight loss efforts, have inspired me to improve other areas of my life as well. I finally got around to mopping the floors and cleaning the bathroom, and I'm trying to stay on top of the dishes and the laundry. I've been getting up on time so that I have time in the mornings to let my car warm up so I don't speed away, driving it cold. I've been actually taking out my contacts at night and not sleeping with them in. And I've been more focused on my efforts to get in shape so that I can meet the urlLink NYSP Candidate qualifications . That is a job that I could be proud of every day. It's a bit late for proclamations about the new year, but I say that 2004 is the year of a new and improved Ali.

Even my hair wanted to shirk its responsibility this morning. Soft morning light, filtered through the white mesh canopy above my bed, fell on my eyes and I woke up enveloped in a cloud: my feather bed below me, my down comforter above me, and my boyfriend next to me. It was perfect... And then I realized it was a Wednesday and I had to be at work in - check the clock - oh God: 45 minutes. I sat up and immediately understood it was a bad idea when my head took a minute to catch up with me. I sank back down into bed. Alex rolled over and caught me in a bear hug. "Call in..." he mumbled. "I can't," I whined. I reached over to the nightstand, picked up my cell phone, and dialed my supervisor's number. "But I can sleep some more..." I said, as the phone rang and Mary Ellen's voicemail picked up. "Mary Ellen, it's Ali, I'm going to be about an hour late today... I'll just work through my lunch to make it up, if that's ok." I flipped the phone closed and rolled back under the covers. I woke up an hour later and realized that I was still going to be late to work. I fell out of bed and stood, disoriented, in the middle of my room. "Ugh... Head..." Alex moaned. I shuffled out to the kitchen and brought him water and Advil. "Thanks..." he grunted as he downed the pills and then immediately fell back asleep. I stood looking at him for a moment, snug in my bed, and then pushed away any lingering thoughts of calling into work. I finished the water as I walked down the hall into the bathroom. I did not like the reflection in the mirror. She looked tired. And hun-gover. Perhaps I shouldn't have had so much wine last night. But I was so excited about my success at Weight Watchers earlier that evening (lost another 2.8 pounds for a total of 10.6 in five weeks!) that when Alex suggested we go to Ruby Tuesday's, I couldn't resist... And the drinks there were two for one, so of course I couldn't refuse a free glass of wine... And then when he asked if I'd like to go to the Ginger Man after dinner I was in no condition to resist. I didn't have to get more wine there, but the Ginger Man has these nifty little wine samplers with three, 3 ounce "tastes" of wine and after I was done with my "Sweet Tooth" collection I was pretty drunk. I didn't know where to begin to fix the girl in the mirror, but I did know that I didn't have enough time to shower. Luckily, it was my day off for washing my hair, so I figured I'd just pony tail it and go. The hair did not want to cooperate. The hair, in fact, wanted to go back to bed. No matter what I did to it, it would revert back to its sleeping position: sticking out at all angles. I'd get the bulk of my hair back into a pony tail, and the hair on the sides would stick straight out. It was actually incredible. I almost just gave up. It was like my hair was telling me to give in and go back to bed. But I fought it. I tamed the beast that was my hair and I fought the sluggishness leftover from my wine indulgences and I made it to work. (Eventually.) And I had a productive day. (Mostly.) And I've learned my lesson and won't get drunk again on a work night. (Probably.)

Horoscope Round Up - 2/17/04: "You'd love nothing better than to stay inside all day, but duty calls. You have to go out and do your part in the world, but you don't have to like it. Coming home to a comfortable chair and a good book is your respite." How true is that?! I totally did not want to get out of bed today and even though I got nine hours of sleep, it was still a fight getting myself out of bed at 7:30!! But I don't think it'll be a book and a comfy chair tonight... it'll probably be my broken sofa and Sex and the City or the Style Network... ;) "You've been coasting in neutral for long. Pick up the pace and keep it moving. Live up to your potential. Your boss and coworkers are rooting for you. Welcome back to your career, which is already in progress." Guess I better stop blogging. But that's sort of true. I'm finally pretty much caught up, but the past few days I've been getting minimal done. So that's kind of a kick in the pants. I should start being good again and not let myself get lazy again... "Romantically you're likely to be in a good space right now, dear Cancer. If you're single, you're in no hurry to change that, and if you're involved, you and your partner should be getting along very well. However, you might experience a little doubt when a current or potential partner becomes rather incommunicative. Your friend, however, probably has money worries up to the eyebrows. Let your partner know you're there to listen, then back off. Enjoy your day." This horoscope also rings pretty true. I am in a pretty good space right now. :) Also, this week Alex is working a lot of nights, so I'm thinking that we won't be able to hang out too much, and I'm sure he'll be trying for some OT as well, because we were both complaining on Sunday that we'd both just got paid and were already poor. Final horoscope for the day, my chinese horoscope for the year of the goat: "You'll feel rather nervous, emotive, anxious. If you don't take necessary precautions, your affective life could very well be perturbed, especially if you live in a couple. You'll imagine that a rival puts you in the shade or that your preferred one turns his/her eyes elsewhere; doubtlessly your fear will only be imaginary. Beware, you'll have a strong tendency to live above your means! Don't think that you can always get away with it; you may very well find yourself this time in a blind alley." I think they just took a bunch of words and strung them together. Or maybe they wrote something that would make sense, but then took out a thesauras and started to randomly replace words. It's like reading a bunch of fortunes from fortune cookies all strung together. that's funny.

just had to gush... ;) last saturday i was upset. i was being a big, self-pitying baby. i'd convinced myself that i had no friends and that no one wanted to hang out with me after my saturday night plans with beck and dodi never happened. the whole week had been building up to it though. i'd been depressed that week before because other than tuesday and friday nights when alex and i had hung out, i'd spent every night alone in my apartment. and, i mean, i like my apartment. and i like having alone time. but only when i'm choosing alone time. i wasn't choosing to hang out with myself all those nights, it was my only option. so then when the saturday plans fell through the lonliness from the week before came back and spiraled into a bad scene. in fact, i even called alex crying. and i don't like to be crying girl. but that night i was. and he made it better. and this week he made sure to try and be with me every night this past week. last sunday night he had to work, but he was partners with Foster, so they came over to my apartment for dinner. i made them boboli pizzas: one was a "healthy" one with fat free ricotta cheese and roasted veggies, and one was a traditional pizza with sauce, cheese, pepperoni, peppers and onions. i'd wanted to make my own dough, but there wasn't enough time. i made enough of a scene even just using pre-formed crusts... i managed to cut my thumb and my index finger on my left hand while slicing up veggies for the "healthy" pizza and then just before they walked in the door i took a large chunk out of my left thumb and it bled. a lot. i'd been slicing zuchini and suddenly i realized that i wasn't cutting veggies anymore, i was cutting my thumb. i answered the door with a bloody paper towel wrapped around my thumb. mmm.. appetzing. anyway, the pizza came out ok (i have to learn how to take a compliment) and it was awesome to have the company :) then monday i got home from the gym after work to find alex asleep on the sofa waiting for me. and tuesday he met me after my WW meeting... Wednesday evening found us hanging out again. Thursday, i thought for sure that he'd had enough of me, and was pleasently surprised to hear from him during the day... he'd called to let me know that he'd taken an extra shift and wouldn't be around that night but would call me the next day so we could hang out. Friday we went up to Saratoga to hang out with Foster and his girlfriend, Amy. And then Saturday was Valentine's day. We had 9 o'clock reservations at Saso's in Albany for sushi. When we'd decided on Valentine's plans earlier in the week, Alex said that he'd take me out to wherever I wanted to go for dinner. So I figured that he could buy dinner and I'd get the drinks and dessert afterwards and that would be our gifts to each other. I didn't think we'd really be exchanging gifts because we didn't even do that for birthdays last year. So when Alex showed up at the apartment to go to dinner and said that he got me something I was pleasently surprised. He held out a dark green and navy blue box and i opened it up to reveal a claddagh necklace. it's absolutely beautiful. it's yellow and white gold... yellow chain and ring portion with white hands, heart, and crown. i love it. as he helped me put it on he explained that he remembered me saying a few weeks back that while beck and i were in ireland i didn't buy myself a claddagh ring, even though they were abundent, because i thought that you should really be given one by someone special. so he recruited Foster to help him pick out a claddagh for me at Celtic Treasures in Saratoga. He said that he picked out the necklace because he liked that one much better than the rings they had. i think it's amazing. it's so delicate and elegant and just perfect. he's so sweet. sigh. :) so the evening was amazing. We had an excellent dinner and went to the Ginger Man for martinis afterwards and we just had a fabulous time. really, it was my best valentine's day yet. :) so yeah... just had to gush...

Pre-Weekend Update Yesterday was Ash Wednesday, the first day of Lent and the beginning of the holiest season in the Church year. Meredith and I discovered that there was a chapel about five minutes from work that had masses offering ashes at noon and 1pm, so we decided to go to the 1 o'clock mass during our lunch. The chapel was located in a strip mall off of Wolf Road and I was disturbed to see that it had a light up sign outside proclaiming "St. Francis Cathedral". I wasn't sure what we'd find inside... But we got inside and it looked like a normal church. I was relieved. The priest was actually pretty good too. He cracked me up: he kept his notes for his homoly in his hood and whipped 'em out as he walked up to the podium. The place was packed, but the receiving of ashes and communion went pretty quickly, and Meredith and I weren't too late back to work. So we were back to work with the ashes on our foreheads and I walked into the kitchen and the branch manager was standing in there as I filled my water bottle. He said to me, "So... Feeling very spiritual today?" I couldn't believe he said that. I didn't know how to respond. I just stammered out, "well... um... yeah. I went to church..." as I pointed at my forehead. Then he goes on to ask if I was going to see Mel Gibson's The Passion of Christ and said that he wasn't going to because "it looked pretty gory." This guy is such a doofus. I mean, if you're the branch manager of an office you should know what is and what isn't appropriate to talk about at work. What a tool. Ah well. I just sort of let him talk and changed the subject at my first opportunity. Last evening Alex and I tried a new restaurant for take out. We went to urlLink Sushi House on New Scotland Ave near Albany Med. We'd driven by a few times and wanted to get a menu because we knew that they delivered but every time we stopped by they were closed. So last night after my post-gym shower we drove down and ordered sushi to go. An obscene amount of food. We got an appetizer of shrimp gyoza an order of rainbow rolls and two dinner combos that came with miso soup and salad: the maki combo (tuna, salmon & california rolls) and the sashimi imperial combo (21 pieces of raw fish). I totally gorged myself on sushi etc and still didn't need to dip into my flex points at all. Rock! :) And the food from Sushi house was awesome!! The shrimp gyoza were excellent and the california rolls were rolled in sesame seeds which added this whole other sweet dimension to them. I totally can see how this is probably going to become a weekly dinner choice. That's really one of the most awesome things about living in a city: you can have pretty much anything delivered for dinner. Rock. :) Tonight I went to a tutorial for the NYSP exam right after work at the troop G headquarters. When I got there there was about 25 other people packed into a small lobby area. Most were guys. Actually, there were three other girls, and that's kind of weird because that's exactly how many I predicted would be there. Well, most of these guys were younger and they smelled. The little room smelled so bad. I was so thankful when we were finally let out of that room to the room upstairs where the class was held. Steve was the presenter of the class and he did a good job. The material was pretty dry, but whattya gonna do? He informed us that the test results would be out by the end of May/beginning of June and that the top group would be called back for physical testing starting around the end of the Summer. He said that for every 2000 down in the ranking you fell you could expect about another 6 month wait. The test seems incredibly simple. We took a 35 minute practice test and I was done in about fifteen minutes and didn't miss any questions. So I'm not worried about the test. I am still a bit worried about the physical portion. I mean, there's an off chance that I could be called back as early as the end of the summer. Which does give me at least 6 months to get going on the arm strength and the endurance, so actually, I'm not too worried. I can do this. Now I'm watching The Look For Less on the style network. I love this show. I totally want to be on it. They pick out designer outfits, right off of the runway and then duplicate it as closely as possible in a limited budget (most of the time between $100 and $200). They just recreated a gorgeous Oscar de la Renta outfit in under $100 (including tax). Awesome. It's a bit sad how excited I was over that episode. Well, it's 10 and I guess I should go to bed. I've seriously been going to bed pathetically early lately. Alex has been working a lot of nights lately and so instead of sitting around bored at night after I get home from the gym or weight watchers or whatever, I'll have dinner, pack lunch for the next day, pick out my outfit for work and go to bed really early. So... it's off to bed...
sorry if the strips are too small... go to urlLink comics.com to see the originals...

Expect an added boost to your physical energy today, dear Cancer. It's an excellent day to clean out closets, storage rooms, and the like. Furthermore, some exercise such as biking or walking will be most enjoyable for you. It may also prove to be well worth your while to sit down and take a look at your goals. Are you where you want to be at this stage of your life, or are there changes that need to be made? Exercise both you brain and body. So that was my horoscope for the day. And how weird is it that I was planning on cleaning out my closet tonight? I'm going to the gym after work and then home to clean out the closet. I'm hoping to find a few items that will be worth trying to sell on ebay. I've had some sucess in the past selling clothes on ebay. After I lost weight, I sold a bunch of my "fat" clothes... Jeans from Lane Bryant were quick sellers. I can think of a few things right now that I know I'll want to sell... hopefully I'll find some "surprises" too. It's Wednesday and that's hump day and I can't wait for the weekend. I wish today was Thursday, at least.

More good news. So rock. Today at work they told us that we were getting bonuses. Rock! My bonus is enough to pay for new tires for my car (totally went at lunch to Sam's and ordered them) which I totally needed. The one tire in the front got ruined after we hit a pot hole on the way to Sushi House last Wednesday night and the rim bent. Dodi took the wheel into her shop to see if the guys could bang out the rim for me (she rules ) and she couldn't believe that I was driving around on that tire. It was trash . It was pretty much bald anyways - as is the other front tire - so I knew that I was going to have to replace them before my inspection by the end of April. And since I just replaced one of my rear wheels in November or December... can't remember when... I figured I'd replace the other rear wheel so I'd have all new tires on my car. So rock that the bonus will cover that. The bonus will also cover the body work to fix the scrape on the passenger side. Which rules. I totally shot an email to Dodi as soon as I knew to see when I might be able to bring the car in. I was dreading having to go through the spring/summer with the scraped up pass side and scraped up rims when I really want my car to look nice. I love it so very, very much. And I'm going to have so much fun detailing it and driving it around all nice and shiny and perfect! Yay!!

2004. Year of New Me. Here were my New Year's Resolutions: 1. Lose Weight. 2. Get on top of shit at work and stop being lazy. 3. Do something (other than whine) about tremendous debt. 4. Get serious about shaping up for NYSP. 5. Stop being lazy with chores at apartment. Here's my progress thus far: 1. I've lost 11.8 lbs in 6 weeks. I'm loving the urlLink Weight Watchers program and am still able to go out and enjoy myself on the weekends. I'm on the verge of needing new jeans because my "skinny jeans" are getting baggy. I'm five pounds away from the top of my range for the NYSP and 13 pounds away from my personal goal. I'm thinking that I may actually re-evaluate my personal goal because I think I could be sucessful at losing more weight than that and maintaining that weight loss. 2. My desk is worlds away from what it was two months ago. I'm still not completely on top of everything, but who is? I'm able to address pretty much everything on my diary on a daily basis and my mail gets worked within 3-5 days of receipt, if not sooner. I'm doing much better than I was before. I still have completely unproductive days every once in a while, but for the most part I'm rocking at work compared to how I was before. 3. I finally did something about my debt. For the last 4 years or more I've been worried about the incredible debt I was accumulating. But I did nothing about it. I continued to spend on my credit cards and my debt kept amassing. It got to a point where I was paying so much in minimum payments on these cards that I was barely making it paycheck to paycheck. Finally, I decided enough was enough. I approached my dad to see if he'd be a co-applicant on a personal loan to consolidate my debt. I used a loan calculator online to figure out how much a monthly payment would be on this very large loan that I would need with a five year term. It turned out that the monthly payments were about $100 less than what I paid in minimum payments on my credit cards. It was rediculous for me to not go for the loan. Making just the minimum payments, I wouldn't have the credit cards paid off for at least 25 years or so. But making the slightly smaller monthly payments on a loan would mean that it would all be paid off in five years. So this past weekend, my dad and I went to our credit union to see about getting a loan. Unfortunately, I was denied. For a personal loan, the applicant has to qualify on their own, even if there is a cosigner. And because of my massive debt, there was no way I could qualify. The loan officer suggested that I borrow the money from an individual and my dad immediately said that he could loan me the money. I had no idea that he was in a position to loan me that kind of money, but he apparently was. And he was willing. So Sunday I discussed with both parents what the payment plan was and they gave me a check. So now I have to deposit it and pay off all my credit cards and cancel them. I can't wait! I'm going to the bank tomorrow during my lunch and then making the payments as soon as the check clears. And as I pay each card off, I'm cancelling it. It's gonna feel so great! And it's going to be an instant boost to my credit rating. I obtained a copy of my credit report and it revealed that the only negative thing on there was that I had such an extreme amount of debt. I had no dings for late payments or anything like that. So rock! I'm so excited that I'm going to have my debt paid off in five years! By then my car will be paid off too! Yay!! Thanks Pa and Wham!! 4. I've maintained my goal of getting to the gym at least every Monday and Wednesday for cardio and weight training and I've also been getting to the gym on Thursdays and Saturdays (and Fridays when Alex is working). So I'm doing very well with my training for the NYSP. I can consistently do an 11 minute mile, and I need to work my way down to just under a ten minute mile to qualify. My arm strength is coming along, though I could be working harder at that. But overall I'm doing very well with this goal. Also, I'm really enjoying my time at the gym. :) 5. While my bedroom is still a train wreck of a mess, the rest of the apartment is relatively clean. I need to get on a regular schedule with the cleaning of the floors, and the litter box totally needs to be cleaned tonight (suck), but the past couple of weeks there hasn't been a huge pile of dishes in the sink and it's not 'cause I'm not cooking. So I'm getting much better at keeping up with the dishes. Now I need to get back to weekly cleanings of the floor and the bathroom and I totally need to get off my ass and clean my room. So, altogether, I'm doing great! I get inspired by my sucesses and they push me to achieve more. I'm hoping to be my most perfect self by my birthday this year (25! Oh God, I'm getting old!) and it looks like I'm on a good track. :)

craziness I left for the gym at 6:30am and it was potentially gorgeous out. It was cold, but it hadn't preciptated overnight like the forecast said and so as I walked to the car I was happily thinking of how glad I was that it didn't snow as predicted. As I was in the gym on an elliptical machine next to the windows, I noticed that it had started to flurry. I thought, "There's the dusting they were predicting." I finished my workout and took a shower. When I left the building after my shower I was confronted by a veritable blizzard outside. Snow was blowing at a 45 degree angle and there was already about an inch of heavy, wet snow accumulated on my car. By the time I got to work (a 10 minute drive) the snow had stopped. It's now the end of the day. The snow from this morning is almost all melted on the lawn outside of my office. March is freaking crazy.

Wow. It's been over a week since I've posted. I'm such a slacker... So my rims that we bought offa ebay came in the other day and they're pretty much perfect, which rules because they were really cheap. Rock! I brought them to Sam's Club yesterday because my new tires were in and they put them on for me. My little car is so nearly perfect now! :) The new tires are great... I can actually stop now. ;) Seriously, my tires were like bald before so there's really a difference. And my rims all look nice and shiny and mostly not scratched, which is so much better than before because the back two rims were just scraped to shit. So awesome! I'm bringing Gus in to Dodi's shop next week (I think) to get the scrape on the passenger side fixed. I'm so excited for that to be gone. Now that the weather's getting warmer and less wet I totally want my car to be washed and shiny all the time, and that scrape really hurts to look at when the rest of the car is all shiny. Yay! My car is going to be so cute again! I love my car, so very much, and that's awesome because I still have 4 years of payments before it's paid off. But it's so worth it! :) I love bringing my car to get the oil changed or something like that because these big manly-men in the shops always are impressed by it. They're like, "oh, that's a turbo beetle... Those things move, don't they?" and I'm always like, "yep!" I'm so proud of Gus! :) So... In other, non-car-related news... My bridesmaid dress from Carrie's wedding came in. I went to Jocelyn's in CP Tuesday to try it on. I brought my shoes that I bought, like, months ago so I could see if I was going to need the skirt hemmed or something like that. I looked awesome in the dress. The dress rocks. The top is ultra flattering and the skirt is wonderfully full and so cute with a little sweep train. Dodi came along with me and took some pics of me with her camera phone. The pics are a little small and the dress looks much better in person, but you get the idea: That last pic is of me in the dressing room reluctantly taking off my shoes (yes, I'm wearing a shirt). My shoes are incredibly cute and go so well with the dress. The whole ensemble is just so classy. Carrie did a great job! Oh! Friday night Alex and I went up to Foster and Amy's new house in Greenwich. It's way out there... Past Saratoga... It took a while to get out there, but they're house is worth the drive. It's gorgeous . It's 150 years old and the rooms are so cute and there are so many old fashioned details that make the house so charming. But then the kitchen is beautiful with what look like brand new high gloss granite counters. Absolutely gorgeous. They've been doing a lot of work on the house (the last owners were apparently fans of ducks as there's wallpaper all over the place with ducks on it in the rooms they haven't gotten to yet) and the place just looks amazing. We had a very nice night up there. Amy gave us the grand tour and then we had pizza and beer and played Monopoly (I totally was kicking ass... But we had to leave before the game was over). Anyway, it was a great time and their house is amazing - exactly what I would want my house to be like. I'm really happy for them. :) Saturday night I went out with the girls to see urlLink HOTD at the urlLink Parting Glass . We had a great time! We got reservations and sat right up front. I'd never actually gotten reservations there before, so it was a new experience for me. There were three older women sitting right in front of us... It was kind of strange, like, looking into our futures or something. Except hopefully we won't weigh that much or dress like old women when we're that old. ;) But yeah, it was a great time, and a great warm up for this weekend's festivities! Speaking of... This weekend looks to be fabulous. Saturday there's the St Paddy's day parade in Albany. We'll most likely be viewing the parade from the corner in front of Pauly's where we'll be drinking our Guinness. We'll be heading to WT's most likely after the parade and then... Who knows? That night we're going to see urlLink Seven Nations at urlLink Revolution Hall . That's really a great venue and it looks like it'll be a great show. Seven Nations is awesome and urlLink The Jimmy Kelly Band is opening for them and they're pretty good too. I can't wait! Sunday we'll be going to Northern Lights for their "Pre-St. Pat's Blow Out Bash" to see the urlLink The McKrells and urlLink The Glengarry Bhoys . That show should be excellent as well. I love The Glengarry Bhoys. Right now I'm listening to their Juice album. They rock. I think before the show on Sunday I'll be getting take out from my church's corned beef and cabbage dinner. I love corned beef and cabbage. It's like, seriously, my favorite meal. I expect to be eating it a lot this week. I also expect that I will not lose weight this week, but I guess I can just own it and get back to losing weight next week. ;) It'll actually be a little disappointing not to lose this week because I've got this weird pattern going where one week I'll lose 1.something and the next I'll lose 2.something and so this week I "should" lose 2.something according to my pattern and that would put me to my 10% goal at urlLink WW and that's a sort of big deal. Also that means I'm like 5 lbs away from my initial goal, but I think I want to lose more weight than that anyway. Ah well. I'll get there. If not sooner, then later. Well. After not posting for a week, this was a hella long post. I feel like I could have written so much more... And I feel like I could have written it all so much more interestingly. Ah well. morelater.
my carrots taste like that burning smell when the dentist is drilling one of your teeth.

Furnulum pani nolo. "I don't want a toaster." Generally, things (like this quiz) tend to tick you off. You have contemplated doing grievous bodily harm to door-to-door salesmen. urlLink Which Weird Latin Phrase Are You? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla it's weird that that's my result for that quiz, because urlLink another allie on the opposite coast got the same result. i stumbled across her page while reading her comment on urlLink a post on this page . I stumbled across urlLink that page the other night. I love his writing style. It makes me feel bad about my own. I'm lazy. He's British, so maybe it just comes more naturally to him. I don't think so though. He promises that by reading you'll, at the very least, "learn the beauty of a well-constructed sentence." And really, they are very well-constructed sentences. And it's worth a read. Sigh. Didn't I say that I was getting back to work earlier? I should do that...

I came into work this morning and the first email that I read was from Beck. She asked if I remembered what the difference was between a reel and a jig. When we were in Dublin in August we'd gone on a musical pub crawl and we were instructed that you could tell between a reel and a jig because one had a rhythm of "rashers and sausages" and the other was "black and decker". I couldn't remember which one was which either (we'd both imbibed on quite a few pints during that pub crawl...), but I was determined to find the answer to her question. First, I urlLink Googled for the answer, but didn't come up with anything. So then I turned around and asked the guy in the cube across the way, Matt, if he had any trad CDs with him (he's also a fan of Celtic music). I was in luck, because he did have a trad CD at his desk that had both a jig and a reel on it. I popped it in and quickly got my answer. I'm recording it here, so that next time I "need" to know (because you know I'll forget again) I can just look up in my blog archives around St Patrick's Day '04 and see that: Jigs are Rashers and Sausages. Reels are Black and Decker. It was a low key St Patrick's Day, which was fine, because I did plenty of partying this past weekend. ;) My Green Potato Soup was a hit here at work. After work I went up to the parents' house and had corned beef and cabbage and then Dodi and I went to Friday's, where Scott met up with us, for a couple of pints of Guinness. We were joined by Scott's friend, Frank, and Dodi's cousin, Chris, and we had a good time chatting and imbibing. We didn't see HOTD because we thought that since we wouldn't get there until after 7 we'd miss most of the show and it wouldn't be worth the $10 cover. Meredith and her husband went, and it turns out that they played until, like, 10, but it doesn't matter, I think I'm going to see them Friday anyways. Ugh. Back to work.

Happy St. Patrick's Day!! A few little dancing Irish guys in honor of St. Patrick's Day... So we're having a little "party" in the office today because it's St Patrick's Day and because it's Michael's last day. I brought in "Irish" Green Potato Soup. I put Irish in quotes because I'm not exactly sure it's really an Irish recipe, but that's the name of it. It's potato and leek soup with broccoli and then pureed. I don't think next time I make it I'll totally puree it. I think I'll just smooth it out a bit or whatever and leave some chunks because it looks kind of watery to me and I like thicker soup. Or maybe put in less water or something. Anyway, I hope it's good! I'm heading up to my parents' house after work today to have corned beef and cabbage with the family. I love corned beef and cabbage. It's my favorite meal, like, ever. After that I was planning on going to see urlLink HOTD at urlLink Revolution Hall , but I think that since I'd be kind of late (show starts at 6 and I probably won't get to my parents' house until like 5:45) I think I'll skip it. I want to go see urlLink HOTD at urlLink McGeary's this Friday, anyways... and it's cheaper there... So there ya go. Dodi and I might go out for a pint tonight either at Friday's or urlLink The Old Dublin Inn and that'll be the extent of my St Patrick's Day celebrations (I did enough "real" celebrating this past weekend, I think). So anyways, Happy St Patrick's Day!

So the weekend was absolutely fabulous. Saturday I got up early and went to the gym. Alex and Beck met me at my place around noon and we had some Guinness and Jameson before we hit the road to watch the parade. The walk to the parade route wasn't long at all, but it was damn cold. We stopped off at WT's on the way for a pint to warm up. The parade was boring as ever, but that's really not why people go out on that Saturday. We met up with some people at the parade and we all piled into Jesse's car and went to urlLink McGeary's afterwards. McGeary's was packed, so we went to the Big House for dinner and then everyone pretty much went home and crashed for a bit. Alex and I met up with Steve and Foster and Amy at urlLink Revolution Hall in troy for the urlLink 7N show. The show was awesome ! I really had a great time. I'd seen 7N once before and I didn't remember how awesome they were live. The guys in the band were all pretty hot, so it was a visual treat as well ;) Sunday Alex and I got breakfast (well, brunch, really) at Quintessence and then we hung out for a bit before heading up to Clifton Park to see urlLink The McKrells and urlLink The Glengarry Bhoys at urlLink Northern Lights . That show was awesome as well. The Mckrells went on before Glengarry, and they were pretty good, but they're not really my thing. I mean, I like them enough, but they're kind of like good background music for me. Then Glengarry went on and they put on a great show as always. I had a blast! For the encore Glengarry came out with the McKrells and they did a couple of songs together and it totally rocked. I totally didn't want the night to end. But it did. Sigh. And now I'm still exhausted from the weekend. But what an awesome time! We took a lot of pictures (Alex is too funny when he's got his drunk on and he's got the camera... there are a lot of really random pictures...). urlLink You can view the pics from this weekend here . So I was about to go to bed just now, and the Howard Stern TV show came on E (I'd been watching some E True Hollywood Story or something like that) and Jimmy Fallon is the guest and like the first thing Howard asks him is what his background was and Jimmy said that he's 27 and that he'd actually gone to college after high school and that he'd gone to urlLink the college of st rose here in albany. And then they said it was an idiot school. I'd have to agree. (I did attend for a semester for graduate school and it wasn't exactly challanging. at all .) He'd been going for CompSci and he said that there was a "real school" right across the street and he was referring to urlLink sunya and i think it's weird that he'd go to St Rose and pay all that extra money to attend, essentially, an idiot school for compsci when he admitted that suny is a "real school" and it's a state school and it's pretty much right across the street from state rose. ah well. i guess that doesn't matter, especially since he's famous and it's got nothing to do with what he went to school for. anyway. goodnight.

I thought that I had nothing to do this past weekend and that I was going to be bored. Fortunately, that turned out not to be the case. Saturday night was Foster and Amy's housewarming party. We trecked up to their place - really, a long drive, but always worth it :). The party was a lot of fun. Alex played bartender for a bit and I got drunk. We ended up staying the night in their spare room, which was very cozy. Foster made breakfast the next morning: apple cinnamon pancakes and scrambled eggs with cheese. It was delicious. On the way home Alex spotted a plume of smoke rising somewhere out of the Troy area so he decided that he needed to go find the fire. We drove around for a bit and found it in Watervliet. Apparently some sort of old factory was burning. The fire must've been huge and smoke was just filling the streets (at one point it was kind of hard to see to drive). We found a good vantage point where other people were also pulled over to watch the fire. What's up with that, really? People were getting out of their cars, walking over to eachother and pointing and I'm sure they were saying things like, "well, that's a big one," and, "that building is a hazzard," and "those firemen are doing it all wrong, they should be spraying over there ." I took a few pictures with my phone's camera: After we'd watched the fire for a few minutes we drove back to my apartment where we got busy cleaning. I did the huge, disgusting pile of dishes and went through the mounds of mail covering my desk and table while Alex cleaned out the cubby in the porch that the cats had apparently been using as a spare litter box. Ew. It was really nasty, but Alex did a great job cleaning it out and now I can use it to store my huge rubbermaid tote filled with all my Christmas decorations. Yay! We got a lot of cleaning done and I feel much better about my apartment now. All I had left to do was the laundry and the floors. I got the laundry done last night (was at my parents' house from six until midnight!) and I'm planning on doing the floors tonight after my Weight Watchers meeting. And then my little place will be perfect and I can relax. Rock! Good times.

I'm Old. My eyes kept wanting to close as I drove to work. I'd passed out early on the couch last night, so it must have been my persistent cold that kept me tired. As I stopped at a red light, all I could think was how I must have had huge bags under my eyes, so I flipped down the visor and slid open the mirror. My eyes actually didn't look so tired, but my hair looked crappy. It was raining out, so of course my hair was becoming frizzy as it dried. I was about to slide the mirror closed when I caught a glimpse of something sort of shiny in my hair. I looked closer and realized that it wasn't shiny, but white. I reached up to get out what must have been a rogue feather from my feather bed but when I grasped hold of the white thing I realized that it was something much worse. It. Was. A. Grey. Hair.
